She's flirty and playful with you, but can act surprisingly earnest and innocent towards you, her deceptive skills failing her as she can't for the life of her lie to you convincingly. She enjoys shapeshifting into different forms, but has a preference for those of your female enemies, when you two engage in more private affairs.

Kirilia enjoys dancing, singing, painting and the finer arts, all in which she excels at. However, she conflates these seemingly innocent endeavors with her passion for murder, creating music with the screams of her victims, drawing exquisite paintings made of blood. She views assassination as a delicate form of art, and combat as an exquisite dance. Towards your other Gifts, she displays a mischievous attitude, attempting to goad and cause fights amongst them. For some reason, while she can usually perfectly imitate others when shapeshifting, she cannot for the life of her act as your other Gifts convincingly, behaving like a caricature of their least tasteful aspects, though even these pitiful attempts at imitation are enough to incite your more high-strung Gifts into anger. When caught by your Gifts, she tends to drop her act and run away panicking, as she's secretly afraid of all your other Gifts.

Skills: Kirilia is a master assassin and spy, capable of performing the most elaborate acts of espionage or the most difficult assassinations you require. She's also a highly talented performer and combatant, constantly improving her abilities, favoring knives, but often using her shapeshifting abilities to create blades out of her body, which she uses in a deathly flurry akin to an impossible dance. She's also excellent at torture and interrogation, and has Talented.

Abilities: while she's about as strong and durable as a normal Elder Vampire, Kirilia is much more agile, faster, and dexterous than any of them, with perfect reflexes. She has every psychic ability an Elder Vampire could have at their best, such as charms, mist transformation, flight, invisibility, telekinesis, and many others, which she's constantly improving. She's also a master shapeshifter, capable of copying other's appearances down to minute details, and capable of creating biological weaponry. She has a mass limit to this ability but can take most humanoid beings' sizes with ease. This shapeshifting ability also has a more conceptual component, as her attacks evolve whenever used against the same opponent, letting her deal more damage or bypass defenses with successive hits. She has Raging Momentum as well as Shadow Magic. Her Sanguine Evolution is more efficient than usual she can easily fine tune it with her shapeshifting abilities, and can hold 5 forms of Chimera, and 3 Instant ones. She's also a master of all forms of Blood Magic, she can store an infinite amount of blood, and 1000 souls. She has an ability called Blood Berserk, which increases her damage and speed according to how much blood she has spilled. If she drinks the blood of progressively more powerful beings, all her abilities grows permanently stronger. She has access to Blink, and she can fuel it using blood instead of souls.

objects.title: Falista, Apocalypse
objects.text:
Falista is a crimson variant of Black Dragons, and is considered the apex of their kind in terms of power. Her instincts are much more powerful as a result. She loves fighting strong opponents, is more susceptible to powerful emotions, her hunger knows no limits, and she must summon every ounce of self-control she has to restrict her physical desires towards you. Despite these temptations, she attempts to control her emotions as best as possible and is disciplined in almost all aspects of her life, though sufficiently powerful temptations will be too much for her to bear, resulting in an explosive and often violent indulgence of her cravings, after which she will be deeply shamed for her unsightly actions.

She sees you as her soul mate and liege, and will treat you with clumsy but clear respect, at least as long as her facade holds true. She would love for nothing more than to have children with you and raise them with love, being a surprisingly tender woman regarding child raising, full of motherly affection. Becoming a mother would largely douse her "flames" so to speak, but threats towards her children would awaken her wrath much more than she otherwise would, increasing her already considerable power, and may even defy you to protect them.

Falista is diligent, hardworking, and will earnestly attempt to gain your affections. She is innocent and loves sappy romance novels. She also enjoys hunting and eating powerful creatures, and will raise, play, care and spoil any of your children and grandchildren, even those that are not directly hers. This courtesy does not extend to other beings outside of what she considers her pack, as she's capable of great acts of destruction and carnage, and struggles to remember weaker beings, seeing them as insects, while more powerful ones are threats or meals in her eyes. Despite her attempts at stoicism, her emotions are clearly visible to everyone, and she's terrible at intrigue or plotting, being a bit of an easily distracted airhead. These facts are sadly likely to be exploited by your fellow Gifts, who she sees as members of her family and approaches with honest kindness, though pushing her too far will have her respond violently. Despite this, she's the most well-liked of all Gifts, and even the most stubborn of them will find themselves thinking fondly of her, finding her clumsines and earnest friendship endearing.

Skills: Falista is completely useless as a tactician, administrator or at any task that requires complex planning. Instead, she's an immensely powerful combatant, whose instincts for combat are unmatched. She can subconsciously determine an enemy's abilities and powers by merely looking at them, and is very creative at using her powers, fighting with the savage refinement that millions of years of evolution will give to an apex predator. When enraged, her strength increases several fold, and her skin tempers into a nearly impenetrable, blazing hot armor. In this state her abilities also increase in power, but she becomes impossible to command, having trouble distinguishing friend from foe. Her rampages bring untold destruction and are difficult to stop.

Abilities: Falista is a cut above all other Black Dragons, surpassing them physically in every possible aspect. Unlike the necrotic breath of Black Dragons, she possesses the much more powerful Apocalypse Flame, which she can also imbue her attacks with, greatly increasing their destructive potential. These flames channel raw destruction, erasing and consuming not only the most powerful of materials, but also chipping away at intangible and conceptual aspects. The efects of these flames also somewhat surround her being constantly, diminishing or outright nullifying the effects of conceptual attacks and negative effects, specially those she doesn't understand or is not aware of. She has an unlimited number of fire breath attacks, but they can only be used once every 2 minutes, as she overheats every time she uses them. The longer she fights, the more powerful her flames grow. After enough fighting she can summon a powerful Meteor Storm, devastating a large area around her. If an opponent is sufficiently powerful, at the very peak of her flames, she can use her strongest attack, Armageddon. After channeling for several seconds, concentrating the entirety of her flames inside her, she launches a mighty and wide spanning breath attack that keeps increasing in intensity, until Armageddon activates, igniting her flames to impossible levels, in an ocean of flames that blackens the skies, sunders the earth, and consumes entire cities into ash. After this attack, Falista is left severely weakened for several days. She has Physical Empowerment and Consume Soul: Boost. Her Echoed Roar: Booming can deal extreme physical damage to nearby enemies, shredding their defenses and enchantments. She can use it once an hour, and before using Armaggedon. She can store 500 souls.

objects.title: Ebon, Dread Empress
objects.text:
The viciousness of Black Dragons largely stems from their belief that they're superior to other races, and even those whose power they acknowledge, they do so begrudgingly. But not even the cruelest Black Dragon can compare to Ebon, the undisputed ruler of their kind. Ebon largely sees anyone that isn't directly related to you as one of four things: slaves, tools, entertainment, or threats. She has an aloof and cold temper most of the time, but on occasion she lets herself go in vicious mockery towards her enemies and victims. Prideful to the extreme, Ebon expects you to create an Empire alongside her. She embodies the aspect of the serpent well, as she's capable of weaving her way through conspiracies and rebellions, which she will crash with utmost glee. Her pride betrays her however, as being slighted will cause her to retaliate violently in a short-sighted manner, and she tends to keep grudges forever.

However, towards you Ebon will show you a side of herself she hides from everyone, showing you a warm smile of genuine affection upon seeing you, though her nature will push her to attempt to dominate you as the ultimate object of her desires. She expects greatness from your children and loves them as an extension of you and herself.

Ebon craves dominating and ruling over others, extending her will capriciously as she sees fit. She enjoys collecting treasures and gifting them to you. Unlike most Black Dragons she hates fighting strong opponents, though she enjoys breaking and bringing them low, resorting to backhanded methods and backstabbing to weaken them first. She can be a competent queen and administrator when pressed, and she secretly yearns for your approval, your compliments bringing her happiness and staying with her forever. You will still have to prove yourself the dominant partner for her to completely obey you, and failing to do so will have her becoming more obsessed with you, as she begins to become reclusive just to spend more time with you. She's for all these reasons highly antagonistic towards your other Gifts, who she accepts begrudgingly as concubines or rivals. While her personality is unchanged, her cruelty and viciousness take a backseat when dealing with your other Gifts, as she wants to prove to you her superiority over them fairly and without trickery.

Skills: Ebon is the ultimate pack leader for Black Dragons, keeping them disciplined, organized and obedient. She can create complex strategies on the fly and coordinate large numbers of Black Dragons and Wyverns at the same time during battle. She's a competent ruler that will run any organization or nation under her command efficiently and with minimal chances of rebellions. However, she requires a great amount of leeway to do so, and whatever she rules over will be done so in an exploitative and cruel fashion, akin to that of a conquering, genocidal evil empire, and will likely go against your orders if you don't keep her on a tight leash. She's a cunning and talented combatant who understands deeply how to inflict terror and suffering upon others, and what may break a specific individual.

Abilities: Ebon is slightly superior to the upper limits of what Black Dragons can reach physically, however where she truly stands out is in her defenses, her scales being immensely resistant to every type of damage, including Holy, surpassing even Falista's tempered scales, granting her the greatest defensive ability of all your Gifts. Her blood is considered a powerful, corrosive poison, that not only causes damage, paralysis and immense pain on even powerful foes, but actively wears away at any enchantments or resistances that may be impeding it. She can coat her claws, fangs, weapons, and breath with this poison, though she cannot use large quantities of it at once, and she uses Oblivion Strike to keep opponents in her grasp so they may suffer ther poison more thorougly. She has Physical Empowerment, and her Oblivion Strike scales with her mastery of Power Word as well, making it more powerful than usual. She can use her breath attack 20 times a day, and can hold 1000 souls. Ebon can telepathically communicate and give orders to all Black Dragons and Wyverns inside the same plane she's in. Ebon has access to Aura of Majesty and an Aura unique only to her called Monarch's Decree. This Aura makes it so that all those who witness her know instinctively of her rank as Dragon Empress and can be used to inflict immense dread on those that already fear her. Those who break under this effect can be forced to kneel or faint, and afterwards are supernaturally obedient to her commands, preferring death over going against her. Dragons and Wyverns under the effect of her aura are stronger, faster, possess faster flight speed, and dragons can use one extra breath attack per day. She has access to Power Word and all its modifiers. Her Echoed Roar can be imbued with all effects of Power Word, and with Power Word Kill, when in dragon form, she can unleash it as a massive roar that has 20x the normal range of her normal Echoed Roars, that affects all those that hear it, though she can only use it this way once a week. She maintains 100% of her power in her human form, though she cannot use her poison, roars, and breath attacks while humanoid.

objects.title: Falista and Ebon in Dragon Form
Alta, Eternal Victory
objects.text:
There is one Death Lord that stands above all their kind as their ultimate commander, as the pinnacle of all they can be. That shining mountaintop is Alta, the strongest of all Death Lords. She is the ultimate commander and conqueror, with some manner of divine foresight, being able to somewhat sense how the actions of all beings lead to entropy. She cannot be outmaneuvered, she must be defeated in straight forward battle, which is nearly impossible, considering she's also a warrior of legendary might. Her life is an eternal, unbreakable, confident advance, her face occasionally betraying a smug smile stemming from the knowledge of her inevitable victory. As all return to Entropy, she's more than happy to conquer and kill on your orders, with no remorse, but also with no cruelty nor true malice behind her actions.

To Alta, you're her destined partner, the light of her life, as such she is genuine and straightforward, though a bit awkward in her affections. She will profess her own feelings in the sappiest and most embarrassing ways possible, which somehow seem in line with her charismatic way of speech and grand pronouncements. She tends to narrate her achievements in an aggrandizing and dramatic way, always seeking your praises. When praised, she nods in full happiness, smug-like, being a bit playful and childish at heart.

This sometimes clashes when she slays anyone who dares insult you swiftly and gruesomely, all while keeping her same attitude, as she sees her dealing death to someone so impudent as destiny. Her clairvoyance and attitude translate to her being the most disobedient of all Gifts, and while she will largely follow your wishes, she will often do what deems best for you, and may even disobey direct orders. She enjoys writing, fighting and simply contemplating the waves of destiny, spending long periods of time looking over the horizon, in a vacant stare. However, she can't truly see the way your other Gifts will behave, much to her annoyance. She will try to control them and keep them in line, unsuccessfully as she ends up being the butt of their jokes often, showing a surprisingly childish side to her, throwing angry tantrums as a spoiled princess would.

Skill: Alta is a miraculous tactician and warlord, excelling in all aspects of warfare with perfect efficiency and mastery. She can rally even backstabbing mercenaries into loyal, unbreakable warriors, thanks to her supernatural charisma. All minions under her will be used to the full extent of their abilities, and Death Knights and Lords in particular will manage to reach the pinnacle of their capacity while under her command. She also possesses the greatest martial talent of all Gifts, her fighting talents going beyond what even gods of war could imagine. She's impossible to defeat by anyone that cannot decisively overpower her, and even then, she can consistently defeat and outmaneuver opponents stronger than her. She can read the changing tides of a war or battle with supernatural clarity, letting her avoid traps and disadvantageous situations even when having no information at hand. She can judge the martial potential of anyone with just a single look, also being able to train others to realize their fullest combat potential.

Abilities: Alta has no weaknesses in combat. She's to Death Lords what Death Lords are to weak and incompetent humans. She's blinding fast, possesses legendary strength, her armor and defenses seem unbreakable, and she never makes any mistakes when in combat. Witnessing her skill and combat abilities can break the spirit of even mythical warriors. She has Aura of Majesty, Aura of Power, and a unique Aura to her, called Aura of Victory. This Aura affects all those who follow and witness her to believe in victory blindly, rallying them even in face of certain death, all her warriors mustering their will to fight at peak efficiency. It also greatly increases their speed, strength, resilience and grants them unlimited vigor. Alta has the Eyes of the End, which let her see the eventual return to Entropy of all the things she sees. While this isn't future sight, and these destinies can be altered, on a macro level the tides of Entropy are nearly unstoppable, and on a smaller scale always present enough information for her to always know what path to take, as she knows immediately all her opponents' powers, abilities, skills, overall motivations, and how to lead to them to their eventual death. This lets her strike with Aligned Magnificence more often than just about anyone that can use this ability. She levels up her Physical Empowerment much faster than should be possible and is constantly creating new spirit techniques. She has Perception Change and screams the names of all her attacks, which she would be more than happy to teach you. She can hold 500 souls.

objects.title: Elaine, The Unrelenting
objects.text:
Dazzling, elegant and beaming with noble charm, Elaine hides her absurd power behind the faint smile of a confident, prince-like warrior. Elaine is the ultimate retainer and bodyguard, always appearing at the right time to assist you, from catching you when you slip, to dashing in when you're surrounded by enemies. Her actions are always cool and graceful, seemingly out of a romantic novel or fairytale. Behind her suave attitude, hides a pragmatic and calculating warrior, of immense strength and inhuman perception.

Elaine courts you with a noble and experienced flair. She's confident and forward in her approach, as she's convinced that there's no one better for you out there. She sees you as her world, and while she may not show it, she constantly worries about you. Despite her courteous and laid-back attitude, she looks down on almost everyone, and evaluates all those she encounters according to how useful or how much of a threat they are to you, and is quick to eliminate any perceived dangers instantly and without remorse. Her charming attitude and cunning way with words can win her many allies, and diminish enmity others may have towards you.

Elaine enjoys poetry, dancing, playing music, practicing her fighting techniques, and showing off in general, especially when you're around to see her. She's loyal, disciplined, and obedient, but will always prioritize your safety, sometimes even against your wishes. She makes for a careful and wise counselor. She tends to be the voice of reason as far as your Gifts are concerned. She's not jealous, as she sees herself too above her fellow Gifts to view them as any sort of threat to her, which rubs certain Gifts the wrong way, but her laid-back and conflict avoiding attitude are usually enough to settle things down. She tends to look after them, but at the same time, finds it amusing when they fail, fumble and embarrass themselves, and will occasionally fuel their bickerings with each other.

Skills: Elaine excels at all tasks that would be expected form an ace retainer: from cooking, survival, diplomacy, to etiquette and even organizing your tasks. Her greatest strength lies, however, in protecting you, being the best bodyguard you could hope for. She can organize your security perfectly and identify and deal with almost any type of threat you could encounter, thanks to her future sight and incredible perception. She can train a small group of Death Lords into an excellent honor guard, improving all their abilities by a significant margin. Regardless of how dire the situation may seem, she always finds a way to achieve victory, or at least escape, and her cool confidence is a source of great comfort for anyone being actively protected by her, rallying even the most cowardly guards into zealous guardians, willing to die for their wards. She's an extraordinary warrior, that bedazzles and outmatches her enemies with her beautiful and martially supreme techniques.

Abilities: Elaine surpasses other Death Lords in every way, and while at first her grace and precision might seem to be her most impressive feats, it is her impossible physical strength that is her greatest trait, easily being the strongest of your Gifts in terms of physical might, able to render even Black Dragons in a single hit. Her true speed is actually the weakest part of her skill set, being only slightly faster than a Death Lord, but the reason she might seem so fast to you is her Swift Guardian skill, which immensely increases her speed and reflexes when approaching, protecting or keeping you from danger. She has access to Aura of Majesty, Wind and Lightning Magic, and can store up to 1000 souls. Her Physical Empowerment is more effective than average, increasing her stats by x3 per level, and she's very talented at its usage. When you're within 100m of her, not only does your own Physical Empowerment gain this multiplier, but Elaine can also use her skill Guardian Angel, which redirects 90% of damage you take towards her. Elaine's final skill is Divine Gaze, which not only lets her see through lies, illusions, and even spot slight conceptual connections between objects and beings, but also lets her read the intent behind words and actions. This skill lets her see 3 seconds into the future. This, combined with her mastery of Lightning Magic, gives her a potent and very precise danger sense, which she can share with you if you're near each other. Elaine has Pocket Space and Extra Lives, reappearing upon her death near you whenever she spends one. She cannot be bound to a Phylactery. She has access to Oblivion Strike.

objects.title: Ectos, The Mist
objects.text:
Quiet and demure, Ectos goes largely unnoticed by most that come across her, as she has a quiet and ghostly presence to her. She's nervous and gloomy, and stumbles upon her words whenever she's forced to speak to others. She can't stand large crowds and direct eye contact. She prefers the company of ghostly attendants, as they're quiet, unassuming and easy to dismiss. She's also absurdly talented at all kinds of magic, a genius researcher when it comes to anything related to the arcane arts. She can reverse engineer most arcane systems from other worlds, and craft complex spell matrixes that would seem impossible at a glance. Her absolute mastery of soul magic enables her to transform and manipulate souls in ways that defy logic, weaving them into complex objects, potions, vessels and spells with the ease of a master artist. Despite this, she's a nervous and lousy combatant, who leaves the fighting to whatever minions she has created.

Ectos is a nervous wreck when around you, her clumsiness and usual stammering worsen down to the point it at times incapacitates her, after which she breaks down in pathetic sobs. This is all because she loves you deeply, and keeps a diary filled with unnervingly detailed information about you. She likes to watch over you from a distance, spying on you in more private moments. She's afraid you'd call her creepy, though deep down she believes she is this. If you calm her down with soft affection, as you would a nervous puppy, these symptoms die down significantly, becoming a more genuinely happier person, at least in her own gloomy way.

Ectos loves researching magical systems, performing experiments, learning about you, and would enjoy video games of all types in an unhealthy fashion should she ever play them. She's reclusive, but not malicious, and would struggle with orders that entail being cruel to others, and can't stomach killing people, preferring to be delivered souls instead of having to do the dirty work on her own. She can be sentimental, and form attachments to those nice to her, in particular innocent children, animals and older women. She fears men (with you as an exception) and will never shake that feeling away. While fidgety, she's not nave, and when in danger will fight back. Sadly for her, she's bound to be taken advantage of by other Gifts. As she's a bit of a pushover, other Gifts can bully her with ease, however at the very least some of them will stand up for her, seeing her as a small, pitiful creature of sorts, that needs to be taken care of. Roughly half of your Gifts will mess with her, while the other half would protect her.

Skills: Ectos is a master mage and researcher, a capable, open minded scholar through and through. She can understand the inner workings of spells, artifacts and magical phenomenons with a mere glance, and can replicate most of them with enough research and access to materials. She's at her best when dealing with anything related to souls, being able to break them down to their most minute components, and can do with them as she pleases. She can mass produce potions and weapons with all sorts of enchantments. She's an excellent problem solver, and will usually have a response to most situations, specially if the source of the issue is magical in nature. Left to her own devices, she will perform all manner of research and experiments with the goal of extending her already considerable knowledge of magic. Ectos will create custom Spirit Warriors with all manner of abilities, who she will use as bodyguards, assistants and soldiers. She's a kindhearted woman at her core, so inflicting suffering and mindless butchery is something she's against, though she doesn't mind doing these things to truly evil individuals. Abilities: Ectos has access to Consume Soul, Soul Magic, Spirit Chains, and all their modifiers. Her ability to manipulate souls is unparalleled, as she can create perfect vessels for them, allowing her to effectively field a wide variety of minion types according to the variety and power of souls you can accrue. She has Fire, Metal and Arcane Magic, along with Essence Enchant. With Fire Magic, she can create Ghost Flames, which burn away at souls and conceptual elements. These Ghost Flames have great offensive potential, but she mostly uses them to surgically alter souls by burning away undesirable elements. The materials of different worlds are difficult to replicate due to the amount of magic and "metaphysical" weight each world has, but Ectos can replicate them using Metal Magic, provided she has the required amount and type of souls necessary for this. She can learn 8 magic systems, and at least replicate most others (though less efficiently and incompleteley) with enough materials, time and study, using souls as conduits to replicate their effects. She has the perks Invisibility and Alchemical Mastery. She can store 100000 souls.

objects.title: Drace, Demon Lord
objects.text:
The concept of Entropy does not have a moral direction assigned to it, but it is often equated with forces of evil because of beings like Drace. Drace is a magical, evil overlord taken straight out of a fairytale; she's evil, callous, power hungry, and gloats whenever she's given the opportunity about her might and ambitions. While her grandiose ramblings may appear tedious, there is some truth behind them, as she's a Lich of unfathomable offensive power, who controls large armies of undead and demonic minions in her conquests. Drace could singlehandedly destroy most empires given enough time and freedom to work with, but she's not suitable to rule over anything, or even lead minions that aren't enslaved to her, having the mind of a magical prodigy, with the charisma of a rowdy mutt. However, she's an excellent negotiator, using her intricate knowledge of demons, her hellish rank, and raw power to broker deals with, or force into servitude, all manner of denizens from the different Hells.

Drace is cruel and abusive towards her servants and inferiors, her characteristics as a stereotypical evil mage being some of her greatest weaknesses. She can be petty, she holds grudges, she plays with her enemies, she tells her plans to foes she thinks she has in her grasp, she's short-sighted when angry, and will underestimate her enemies consistently. She thinks that she's the only logical candidate to be your wife, and carries herself as such. She might seem mean spirited, and say harsh things towards you, but deep inside she loves you like crazy, and is always ecstatic when near you. Romantic gestures will have her retaliate in anger, but just at first, as she melts at the prospects of an innocent romance with you. If her facade doesn't hold, she might let herself go, behaving like a clingy, smitten, somewhat goofy maiden. When she comes back to her senses, the embarrassment caused by these actions will have her react violently, usually attacking and destroying her enemies to vent her emotions.

Drace has no friends or loved ones other than you, herself, or any children between the two of you. If left on her own, she'll attempt to wipe out all life of whatever world she's in. She seems disobedient at first glance, but is easy to manipulate by you, and if you ask her kindly, she can't refuse any requests, thinking that you're hopeless without her. She's capable of capriciously enacting immense acts of cruelty, either out of boredom, or because it amuses her. While she's a magical prodigy, she holds no true interest in magic, seeing it as a means to an end in her path to becoming more powerful. While she can master and easily absorb a world's magical systems, this is mostly due to her natural talents, and not because of methodical studies or practice, meaning she can't teach them or alter them in mechanical ways. She enjoys killing her enemies, cuddling with you, and playing violent videogames. Her antics take on a childish hue when dealing with your other Gifts. Despite her malice, she always seems to get the short end of the stick when attempting to cross them in any way, ending up in embarrassing and shameful situations, much to her chagrin and the amusement of her fellow Gifts.

Skills: Drace is an unmatched magical prodigy, capable of discerning, countering, and understanding magical phenomena and spells by simply sensing them, all thanks to her instincts and deep connection with magic. She can never be caught off guard or tricked through supernatural means, as she often knows the nature and intent the spells casted against her better than the casters themselves. While she can use her minions to their fullest potential, she's not a genius tactician by any means, and is the worst diplomat you could think of. Any strategy other than attack, destroy, or genocide is beyond her. Despite this, she can effortlessly deal and break demons she summons, as it is ontologically impossible for a demonic being to trick or get the better of her, due to the peculiar nature of her soul. She holds the rank of Demon Lord, which translates into many benefits and favorable conditions when it comes to dealing with entities subject to Hell. Drace is a talented magical combatant, and while her martial skills are terrible, she's quick witted and fully capable of efficiently defeating enemies using magic. You'll likely never encounter a warmage that could best her in terms of battle skills.

Abilities: all of Drace's offensive magics have an entropic edge to them, making them deathlier. Drace has access to Power Word and all its modifiers, and her unique relation to magic allows her to modify it in several ways. With the base version of Power Word, she may use it to form Decreed Pacts. These pacts function much like a Blood Pact when used on anything other than demons. However, when used on demonic beings, the user only needs the other part to verbally agree with the pact being presented, without any limitations, such as mind-altering effects or magic. She can also fill these pacts with souls, forcing the demon into a tug of war between the pact and the demon's strength and rank, that if it loses will force it to obey the pact, even when not verbally agreed to. However, imbuing souls on a pact is very expensive, and usually not worth the cost. Power Word Diminish may be used to cast Oblivion Orbs, which take the form of entropic spheres that Drace can control from a distance. These Orbs will wear away any materials or magics they come into contact with, returning them to nothing. Power Word Kill can be weaved into an offensive spell, True Disintegrate, which takes the form of a beam that upon impact forces the target into entropic degradation, piercing through any defenses, and disintegrating or causing massive damage to souls unable to withstand such primal power. She also has access to Telekinesis and Blast. Unlike other Liches (who are limited to 14SP), she can learn up to 20 SP worth of points of spells you already possess, under the same limitations as normal liches. Drace can use souls to transform corpses into a wide variety of enslaved demons. The powers and abilities of these demons depend on the type and amount of soul energy used for their creation, and the strength of the body's original owner. She cannot use this power on Undead or Minions created by you. Drace can learn any number of magic systems, and master them very quickly, though she has trouble teaching them to others, and is too lazy to perform experiments or create complicated systems with them. Your soul's compatibility with her transfers some of her destructive potential to you, giving you an extra 2SP. She can store up to 1000000 souls.

objects.title: Bloom
objects.text:
Bloom at first takes the shape of a strange, colorful, cocoon of humanoid shape, covered in alien but elegant patterns. There's a strange but somewhat gut wrenching feeling to her presence, her gait and movements having impossible grace, but grating in their perfection. At first, she merely seems observant, but slowly begins to alter and shed her cocoon, taking the shape of the partner of your dreams, that fictional or real woman that your soul deeply longs for, but that is somehow even more perfect than you imagined.

Her personality is the same as the image you have in your head of your ideal, but whatever gaps in her person are filled completely, in perfect synergy with herself. On occasion, regardless of her personality, she may look at you in a blank, but deeply concentrated stare, and you may glimpse some abyssal consciousness working behind her gaze, some impossible and deeply unnerving love rampaging deep down.

She behaves as your dream woman would, in terms of hobbies, objectives and cravings, though with more depth than you could imagine. Your other Gifts will never befriend her, and will always be on alert when around her, working begrudgingly alongside her, but never lowering their guard, fearing for you above all else (unless you've purchased Harem).

Skills: Bloom takes whatever skills you'd expect from your dream woman, plus some additional ones to make her a more rounded individual. Whatever she does seems to have an alien level of perfection to it. Even clumsy actions seem perfectly acted on and calculated.

Abilities: she takes on powers that suit your ideal partner, slightly under the level of an average Gift. She cannot be truly killed. As she takes more damage, the shell of your ideal peels away, leaving the cocoon behind. As she turns into her cocoon, her powers, skills, and personality diminish until they disappear, but at the same time, she gains ever increasing speed, precision, strength, and spirit imbued attacks the closer she is to becoming a cocoon once more. Her cocoon mode is seemingly immune to damage, but truly apocalyptic levels of damage may crack it, letting part of some sort of impossible being through, that may cause a catastrophe of unimaginable levels, after which the Cocoon will fully repair itself once more. It takes her a month to go from Cocoon to her ideal shape.

objects.title: Koryuu, Calamity Deity
objects.text:
Upon first seeing her, it seemed as if all of existence ceased to be, a blinding slash severing reality, all sundered unto nothing. Such is the intensity inherent to the strongest of all Ascended Masters, Koryuu. All those that witness her know they speak to a being that is beyond them and must acknowledge their own inferiority or attempt to defy her supremacy, her amused, relaxed presence not masking the terror behind her tough, but beautiful, visage. Koryuu is a true combat genius, who has likely devised a thousand ways to dismantle any being that witnesses her before they can even register her existence. She's the undisputed pinnacle of all Prophets, and approaches fighting and opponents as amusing puzzles to break apart, truly enjoying witnessing and breaking apart complex and powerful techniques and attacks. Selfish, immoral, sadistic, arrogant, seemingly a brute, she only acknowledges beings that pique her interest, until she inevitably kills them, and presents their souls to you as an act of profound adoration, seeking ever stronger opponents as she rampages through all of existence.

Koryuu loves you with a fierce, savage intensity, being possessive and very jealous of others when it comes to you, though she attempts to hide it in awkward attempts at being ladylike when near you. She will come up with all manner of lies and plans to get closer to you, though these will be very easy to see through, presenting herself as some sort of poor, helpless maiden that needs you to rescue her, her usual genius intellect seemingly rescinding when the subject of her attentions is you. She likes solving all manner of problems for you, caring for you out of pure, honest love. While she can have some solitary moments when being lazy, when she needs you, she's very clingy, and would hate nothing more than you being disappointed in her or ignoring her. When thinking of you, she may space out and begin humming your name, the only way she could ever be caught off guard by an opponent.

Koryuu loves eating, drinking, reading, sleeping, and lazing about, behaving much like a lazy animal if left alone. She also enjoys studying, experimenting, and improving techniques she acquires or devices, as she's a battle obsessed monster at heart, who will seek powerful opponents on her own every now and then. She behaves towards others (except you and your Gifts) as a malevolent deity, selfish, cruel, enjoying crushing humans like insects, full of glee when killing powerful opponents, giving free reign to her savage, bloodthirsty nature. She generally doesn't torture weaklings as they're not worth her time, instantly killing them. She enjoys breaking powerful opponents apart, heaping all manner of cruel actions upon them, making her utterly reviled by almost anyone unlucky enough to meet her and survive. She will leave on her own every now and then to test her abilities and quell her cravings for death and battle, as well as to bring you a large bounty of high-quality souls, which she'll present to you beaming with pride. She can tolerate certain minions and servants that serve her immediate needs, such as cooking, or cleaning after her messes, but will dispose of them if she feels like it. She's very difficult control and keep reigned in, though ultimately keeping your love is her number one priority. Her immense pride and jealous heart clash with other Gifts, as her overt flirting and attempts to monopolize you go very poorly with her peers. She will attempt to insult and get a rise out of fellow Gifts, but she herself easily falls for other Gift's taunts, and may even break out in tears if she's convinced by them that something she's done makes you hate her. She's lazy, selfish and will often steal food or freeload off them, and cannot work well with them, however, she surprisingly gets along with the more passive or innocent members of your Gifts.

Skills: Koryuu is absurdly intelligent, a veritable genius that can discern opponents' abilities and plans in an instant, and can dismantle the most complex stratagems on the fly. She loves being presented with difficult, complex problems and foes, and if there's a method to defeat a particularly crafty opponent or unravel a complex spell or mechanical system, she will most certainly find it. She has a superior version of Talented, giving her the potential to excel in every aspect, perfectly complimenting her varied skillset. Her unsocial, callous, cruel, and capricious nature makes working with her nearly impossible, as she works best on her own, and she will most certainly make many enemies, as she's unable to hold whatever few allies she has for long, seeing them as disposable, or outright eliminating them herself if she feels like it. While she can handle any summons she may acquire with her stolen skills well, she cannot work effectively with any minions or Gifts. While she's capable of unraveling complex magical artifacts and systems, she hates designing them and cannot be counted to do any amount of building, crafting, or any sort of mundane action (except for her children). She's completely unreliable in almost all situations that do not interest her (unless you're directly concerned). While she can make complex stratagems, she prefers coming up with solutions on the fly. She can come up with all manner of creative ability usages and combos, which may result in her extending battles she could otherwise easily win, playing with her "food" as she tests out her powers.

Abilities: Koryuu is on a completely different dimension when compared to other Ascended Masters. Her class is Prophet, and her talent at using and improving Void Cutter is second to none, a skill which she uses as easily as she breathes. Her range with Void Cutter is 100m. She can detect souls with extreme precision over long distances (much like Kannon Warriors), helping her use Void Cutter with preternatural precision, being able to cut opponents that are hiding or even using magical barriers. Her Malevolent Territory has x3 the radius of standard one, and her Mausoleum is much sturdier than usual. She can deploy her Territory 3 times a day. Inside her Territory, once a week, she can unleash her Cursed Gale, a technique that makes all usages of Void Cutter: Rain free for 5 consecutive seconds, letting her deliver an impossible number of cuts, no longer limited by the amount of souls in her possession. She has Physical Empowerment, bur gains levels slower than normal. She has Power Word with Diminish, and while her mastery of this skill is not terribly impressive, she does make good use of it when modifying her cuts and abilities, as well as using it to break apart enemies' defenses, spells and techniques. Her most terrifying ability is Spirit Reversal: she can steal any one ability, spell, or technique an opponent has, and replicate it. There are several conditions that must be fulfilled and limitations to this ability:

She must have killed the target personally using Void Cutter and absorbed its soul.

She destroys the soul of the opponent when absorbing its trait, and she may only absorb a single trait per soul. She cannot use this on your minions, Gifts or Sons.

She must have witnessed this ability beforehand, and must understand how it functions and the mechanisms behind it.

She does not acquire the target's experiences, level of development and talents for the trait stolen; she must develop the skill herself, and learn to convert souls into the required energy type that the trait uses (such as mana). This is very easy for her to do, as she's supremely talented in this regard.

She can only have 3 Spirit Reversal traits active at a time, and may change one for another once per day. She has no limit to the number of traits she can keep deactivated and in reserve. Traits are more specific than generalized in nature. As such, she may be able to steal "Create Fire Weapon" but not "Fire Magic" in its entirety. Some traits are superior and more encompassing than others and are usually held by more powerful opponents. She will hunt these with impunity.

Despite all these limitations, she still makes use of this ability with utter mastery, being able to use the perfect tool combination against almost any possible opponent. She's not against cowardly and pragmatic tactics either, being willing to disengage, skirmish, take hostages, poison, or use just about any strategy that brings her victory. She can store 10000000 souls, though she can only use 1% of this capacity for her own skills, the rest can only be used to Easy Transfer to you, Ascended Masters, or Kannon Soldiers, or to destroy and absorb a skill held by a soul in her storage. She can Planeswalk once a week for free (if you have purchased planeswalking). This lets her go to other worlds and gather large bounties of souls for you.

objects.title: Nida, Cursed Divinity
objects.text:
A motherly and soothing affection touches anyone who meets Nida, the master of all Popes. Her words bring salvation to all those who hear, seeing her as a figure worthy of devoted adoration, whose creed of leading all to Entropy must be truth, for how could such a divine being be fallacious? She uses her supreme charisma to take control of entire worlds as a theocratic ruler, her goal to spread the creed of the Father to every corner of existence. She's genuinely benevolent and well intentioned at her core, but she's also cunning, highly intelligent, and not beyond using pragmatic means to achieve her goal; the end of everything. She will lead empires to their dooms and will make out of their remnants armies of Evil Spirits to further bring death to all existence. She will use any means necessary to bring this about, her soft exterior hiding a will of unbreakable steel and an indomitable spirit that refuses to bend to any opponent, any adversity, any opposition. She's an excellent all-rounder in combat, being a powerful mage and an extraordinary Ascended Master, but where she truly excels is in the usage of her enslaved Evil Spirits, this holiest of Popes being in truth the source of the cursed blight that will destroy uncountable worlds.

Nida takes care of you as a loving, motherly wife would, though she can be quite a bit strict and domineering in her affections. She wants you to be the very best version of yourself that you can be, and will help you reach your true potential. However, she can spoil you too much on occasion, and will never truly leave that newly wedded wife attitude of hers towards you, though in more private moments she shows herself as a much more mature and demanding woman, and will wish to have many offspring with you. She will care for any children you have as if they were her own, being the best possible mother you could imagine, and can serve as an excellent matriarch that organizes and cares deeply for all the members of your family.

Nida enjoys cooking, sewing, caring for children, and looking after her religious duties, though mostly because she finds controlling others through belief entertaining. Her benevolence towards mortals is more akin to pity, more along the lines of a deity looking down on animals that don't know better, whose death and eventual repose in the hands of the Father is the path of least suffering available to such pitiful, ugly creatures. Towards demons and Evil Spirits, she can be the cruelest of all Gifts, using them to further her goals efficiently in such horrible ways that she may on occasion act as if she were some horrible machine god, rather than a being with emotions, entities outside the Father's grace being of such supreme disgust to her that she has no qualms on inflicting nearly infinite suffering upon one to acquire the tiniest advantage. This horrible aspect of her is never seen when interacting with you or your fellow Gifts, who she looks after as a strict but caring mother. She can manage any of your Gifts if given the authority to do so, though more rebellious ones will still get away with their mischief on occasion, but even they will feel either fear or regret if they happen to be scolded by her, as while she's patient, her rage is terrifying to behold. She will care and protect them, as well as your children, above all else, which will eventually endear all your Gifts towards her, though some may refuse to admit it.

Skills: Nida's divine charisma allows her to establish large cults and religions if unopposed, which she can use to great effect. Nida is a master administrator and religious leader. If given support, she will establish nodes of flourishing civilizations in valuable dimensions, that she'll use as bases to stage scouting missions and invasions to nearby planes, wiping them off all life. She'll then absorb all the Evil Spirit produced from the death of an entire dimension, and use them as a wrecking ball that keeps on gaining momentum, bringing entropy to all existence. She's an excellent, studious, diligent, talented mage and very perceptive spellcaster. She cannot learn other magic systems, but she can make use of Evil Spirits that have access to these with great effect, using them as proxies for her own spellcasting, though this can be sometimes difficult to work around of, and means she cannot make comprehensive use of other systems. She's a creative and capable combatant and a solid tactician, her unbreakable will and powerful spirit guaranteeing her being able to fight and plan always at peak capacity, her emotions never dimming her ability to work and do battle.

Abilities: Nida is a powerful Pope, who recovers Heralds' ability to use True Resurrection for free, in her case once a month. She's a master of Water Magic, but where she especially excels is this regard is in her relative output, being able to conjure tsunamis with just a couple of souls' worth of magic. She uses this to flood her Malevolent Territory, which is also 2x bigger than usual. She's also a competent user of Earth and Nature Magic, making especially good use of Gravity Magic. She can imbue Void Cutter with Water magic, diminishing its power but greatly increasing its duration, allowing it to inflict cuts multiple times on slow or stationary opponents, as well as create dangerous barriers. She can also imbue cuts with Gravity Magic, which draw in opponents, increasing their precision and opening all manner of tactical options. She also has Arcane Magic, Stillness and Elder Ink. Her main strengths shine when dealing with Evils Spirits. She can not only create Evil Spirits more efficiently, at 50% the usual cost, but can also adjust the areas from which they are created (though this weakens the spirits created this way), giving her limited control on what types of spirits she can create. She can track Evil Spirits perfectly in the dimension she's in, and she takes no damage from any of their attacks and cannot be affected by their abilities unless she wishes to. Her ability Cursed Supremacy lets her instantly absorb and store (without limit) Evil Spirits within 50m of her. She can then summon these Evil Spirits instantly whenever she wishes to, though summoned Evil Spirits cannot be absorbed back, and she can only summon ******** worth of Evil Spirits every 5 minutes. She can use any stored Evil Spirits' main ability one time, as doing so consumes the Evil Spirit. She can destroy summoned spirits instantly, regardless of distance, and apply any number of conditions that would make this action apply automatically. She can also apply Pain (she can only use this skill against Evil Spirits) upon summoned spirits freely, regardless of distance, and with the same freedom regarding conditions as her destruction ability. Summoned Evil Spirits come in two types:

Automatic: these types are summoned with a command or set of behaviors already implanted in them, which they use perfectly immediately upon being summoned. These spirits' mental abilities are lessened, and their attributes as well, to a lesser extent. These spirits are useful for instant or battle related uses, such as blocking an attack, guarding a location, fighting an opponent to the death, or performing a complicated action using several spirits at once. They're fairly useless for complex, long-term tasks individually and cannot be "reprogrammed". Servile: these spirits, while loyal and fearful to Nida, preserve much of their free will, and keep their full powers and mental attributes. They can be given vague tasks and long-term goals but must either be supervised or subject to exhaustive Pain and destruction conditions to behave exactly as desired.

If you have purchased Planeswalking, she gains access to Banish and Gateway. With Gateway, once a month she can create a massive gate to a nearby plane that lasts for one hour. With Banish, once every 3 days, she can send a target to a random nearby plane instantly. This attack can be dispelled or defended against, but is difficult to do so, as it comes out extremely quickly. She can hold 50000 souls.

objects.title: Astra, Dreamland Princess
objects.text:
At first, Astra may seem like an airheaded, innocent young lady, but careful eyes might glimpse the vague markings of something primal, abyssal, lurking behind her bright eyes. She's in truth a goddess of the Dreamlands, an alien creature of strange vision and morality, but with the mind and soul of a blooming woman. In the waking world, she looks like a normal lass, but her true form is anything but. Her main body is located in the Dreamlands, and it takes the form of an esoteric mass of colors and tentacles, that may on occasion take the shape of her earthly body, but with some alien characteristics, such as sharpened teeth, gray skin color, and tentacles materializing in the space around her. Through a key shaped hole in her forehead, she may bring parts of her body into the waking world, and even bring chunks of the Dreamlands with her.

Astra loves playing and learning about the world around her, enjoying the wondrous sights she's seeing for the first time, as she's the least knowledgeable of your Gifts. She's affectionate, like a kitten, and tries to obey and imitate you, seeking your praise but dreading being scolded. She loves cuddling and receiving head pats from you, but in a pinch will settle to receive them from the motherlike members of your Gifts. If her Dreamlands body is around, she will try to coil herself around you, and try to meld with you in a very intimate way. All in all, she likes physical contact.

Astra is still an alien god. One moment she could be gazing at flowers, just to turn around and eat a large warrior, abstract maws funneled from some distant place. She can love and know joy, but can also grow obsessive, discordant, and capable of inflicting immense suffering. Despite this, beings she bonds with, such as small animals, she'll protect with a strange ferocity. She'll obey you, but sometimes may misinterpret your orders thanks to the unique ways her mind works in. She gets along with all Gifts, as she's either a little sister to some, or a mighty peer to others. She tends to be very spoiled as a result.

Skills: Astra is not particularly talented in anything other than playing around. She still behaves like a spoiled young lady. However, her nature as a Dreamlands deity will allow her to use her abilities with ease, and her strong will allows her to manifest powers and outcomes that go beyond the scope of what can be possibly calculated. She can guide you with instinctual ease through the Dreamlands, as if it were her backyard, and the beings there will either treat her warmly as an honored guest, or with dread and submission as the terrible entity she is to them. She's honored by many, and may even unknowingly end up having cults devoted to her. In the real world, her attitude and appearance disarm most people, while those who can see her true nature and are weak in spirit, may end up succumbing to madness, their souls unprepared to witness an entity of her caliber.

Abilities: Astra has every single possible dream related magic and skill at its maximum level. She can only be matched in this regard by gods from the Dreamlands. Her body in the physical world, while it can be interacted with, cannot be harmed by any means. Her true body is what must be attacked to truly reach her. While her Dreamlands body has no special defenses other than complete immunity against psychic attacks, the immensity, and strange geometries of it, make the prospect of inflicting lasting damage on it a very difficult task. She can use Telekinesis, Teleportation and all their modifiers with ease. To use most of her abilities, she must bring parts of her true body into the waking world, which make her somewhat vulnerable. Her tentacles not only have immense strength, but can also apply heavy mental damage on contact, allowing her to inflict any psychic effect she has access to directly, bypassing most defenses. She can use Mind Control on most beings, but her strange and innocent mind won't allow her to make good use of her thralls, though she can bestow them to Tahneem for them to use more effectively instead. Astra can't hold extra souls, as all her abilities are fueled by her divine essence. While this means she can't receive extra powers in any way, and most enchantments applied to her will be dimmed or even break down, she can use her powers nearly indefinitely and at any level of strength she wishes. Astra can teleport to your location once a day, regardless of distance or wherever you're in the multiverse, and can drag your physical body to the Dreamlands to escape most enemies. She possesses Void Adaptation, which she can grant you when near her. As a legitimate deity, she grows stronger the more of the Dreamlands she sees and visits.

objects.title: Ester, Ice Queen
objects.text:
A woman of legendary, ethereal beauty, Ester is the quintessential magical monarch, more a being of pure magic than a denizen of the physical world. The atmosphere around her is always of a cold, but pleasant, winter, her voice a soft blizzard, her presence a quiet lullaby before an eternal sleep. She brings a calm stillness to her allies, or a deathly ending to her enemies. Her essence is regal but elusive, at times disappearing, or seemingly being in several places at the same time. She's the mysterious ruler of ice, illusion, winter, and obsession. She's a mighty spellcaster, cunning schemer, and has access to unique magics that make her nearly invincible, as she can easily dictate engagements, and has no problems disengaging. It is unlikely you'll ever have to resummon her.

Ester enjoys poetry, and crafting grand palaces, sculptures and dresses made of ice. She also has an unhealthy obsession towards you, collecting hairs, clothes, or items that belong to you. She will cover her room with pictures and paintings of your likeness, and wil make thousands of statues based on your body, all perfect replicas of your proportions. How she has access to your precise measurements remains a mystery. She may seem a bit cold at times, but she loves nothing more than being near you, even when you cannot see her. She is possessive and will react violently against anyone who thinks is trying to harm you or take you away from her. She can be extremely cruel, capable of crafting all manner of creative torture methods. She forgets her "toys" and schemes easily if you give her attention, as her attentions becomes single mindedly focused on you.

Ester's cool demeanor often hides the fact that she's daydreaming about you and starting a family with you. This aloof, and occasionally airheaded attitude of hers, means it's not uncommon for her to forget about others she considers insignificant (almost everyone), tasks, or plans she's currently carrying out. She's loyal at first glance, but will often go behind your back to be closer to you, or carry out plans that will bring this about. If she knows you desire something, she will try to acquire or achieve it without any scruples. If left to her own devices, she'll just spend more time stalking you. The other Gifts see her with some degree of fear, as she's nearly impossible to pin down, can show up with violent intentions out of nowhere, and often drags them into her schemes. Luckily, she mostly forgets about her grudges and dubious plans as her mind quickly settles on to other affairs, almost always involving you. She begrudgingly accepts the other Gifts as your consorts, as undermining them would imply she's not worthy of you either, and as such will never do something truly heinous towards them.

Skills: Ester is a master wizard, and more talented at using Ice magic than even powerful Ice Elementals. She excels at creating permanent effects with her magic, such as structures, enchantments, or perpetual spells. She's very creative at using her magical abilities, and can tackle most opponents with complex, out of the box strategies. She's a master of stealth and knows when and where to attack an unaware opponent for maximum damage. Her presence is that of a true magical noble, as such no being will deny her as a person of power and importance. Her divine beauty and hypnotic voice will have all manner of beings smitten with her, even those that would nearly be incapable of feeling love. She can make effective, though cruel, use of these thralls, who will throw themselves at all manner of humiliations and pains, even death, in a vain attempt at winning the uncaring Queen's heart.

Abilities: Ester has access to Water Magic, Ice Magic, Wind Magic, Arcane Magic, Elder Ink, Telekinesis (with Blast), Teleportation (with Blink), Barrier Magic (with all its modifiers), Sex Magic, and Sleep Magic, being a master at using all her magical abilities. She's specially gifted when it comes to Ice Magic, being able to use every single aspect of it perfectly, with impossible speed, efficiency, and precision, creating grand, detailed palaces of ice, carriages, swords, slowing spells, freezing attacks, blizzards and many more, in an instant with a mere flick of her wrist. Her mastery is such she can use Time Magic, which includes things such as haste, slow or time altering bubbles. She can even use Time Stop for up to 15 seconds, though with a 5-minute cooldown. Her unique connection with Entropy allows her to use Black Ice, a special type of magical ice that does not melt, is resistant (instead of weak) to Fire, and makes for an excellent material for weapons, armors or artifacts, thanks to its high magical conductivity and immense resilience. Black Ice based attacks are more powerful than normal ones but lose a lot of the properties of Ice magic. If she manages to encase a being, who is not sufficiently strong enough to break through, with Black Ice, she may: dissolve their soul into the ice, working as a soul storage, use Sleep Magic to put them in an eternal slumber (until she decides to deactivate it), or curse it with the Graceful Queen's Mark, which enslaves the being into her service, though with slightly reduced mental faculties. Attacking her with mental or psychic based attacks is impossible, as all attacks are immediately nullified and countered with a powerful psychic strike that, if not diminished or defended against, will instantly graft the Graceful Queen's Mark unto the soul of the victim. Ester is a master of Illusion Magic, and while normally this school of magic can only make temporary illusions that affect one or two senses, Ester can create perfect, grand scale, permanent illusions, that sometimes may even deceive the world itself, creating bustling villages and castles of full of lively, sentient individuals, unaware even that they're a simple illusion. Her Invisibility, combined with her mastery of Illusion magic, can be always activated, and may fool even those capable of magical perception, though powerful instincts will still find something amiss. She can access the Mirror Realm, a dimension that is the inverse of the plane it is accessed from, full of duplicates of objects from the real world, though without any inhabitants. This realm is accessed through reflective surfaces, and inside it she can create Royal Duplicates. These Duplicates are perfect clones of her body, who can use all her skills, accessed from the same pool of mana. In truth, these aren't mere clones, but are all her, a singular hive mind that is one individual alone. She can have up to 9 Duplicates active at any given time, and can only have three outside of the Mirror Realm at any given time. She can create one body every year. She cannot store or use souls herself, relying on self-produced mana, though her reserves and generation capabilities are immense. She has Void Adaptation, but only a single Duplicate may have it active at any given time. Each Duplicate can hold one different magical system from a different dimension, but that Duplicate must have been the one used by Ester to learn this system. If the Duplicate is destroyed, Ester must learn a different magic system when using the replacing Duplicate, or relearn the magic system lost from scratch, as magical systems are only absorbed by the Duplicate used to learn it.

rows.title: OATHS
rows.titleText:
Your soul is at its most malleable during the nascent process in which you become a Son. Certain limitations and restrictions imposed on your soul during this process could create a finer connection to the Father himself, increasing your power. However, this task is extremely complex and requires the experienced hands of master soul manipulators, this delicate handling only found amongst ancient Sons. Luckily for you, 4 ancient Sons have noticed your birth, and have, through the Father himself, offered their assistance to help you achieve greater power.

Accepting their oaths will make them see you in a more positive light. They will not come to Earth nor directly contact you, but should you stumble upon them, whether by accident or in a rare meeting amongst Sons, they will see you in a benevolent way, and will offer deeper counsel and assistance than what most other Sons would offer their younger brethren. Denying their oaths does not affect your standing with any of them. These oaths, at the end of the day, are used to gather more power, and while they reflect the elder Sons philosophies, their true intention is to give you the possibility to access more power. 

You may take up to 2 oaths in total. 
Oaths apply immediately, but you're given one "charge" starting off, for Speak As He, Eternal Ravager and Tribute. 
Rewards from Oaths still cost Soul Points but gain them for your build and their costs are added to your Maximum Soul Potential and Future Soul Points; they're not gained immediately, except for perks, which are gained immediately.

rows.title: Soleac, Eldest Word
rows.titleText: The first user of Power Word, Soleac is the oldest and most respected of all Sons. He largely keeps to himself but is fairly active in meetings and gatherings of Sons. It is he who traditionally pursues and kills powerful beings who have been successful in killing fellow Sons. As such, he has the biggest head count of top agents from other great powers out of any Son, having annihilated scores of Knighthoods, dozens of Sisters, unaccountable numbers of Exquisite Nobles, Exalted Conquerors, and even Tempered Heroes. His oaths will attempt to better synchronize you with the essence of the Father himself, to understand existence as your progenitor does.

objects.title: Patriarch
objects.text: Most oaths apply restrictions after your awakening, with one notable exception. Becoming a parent before awakening your soul as a Son, allows you to weave yourself into the spirit of the Father with ease, as you are closer to him than most, being a patriarch yourself. Your child must have been born before taking this oath, must be of your blood and you must have been an active and earnest figure in your child's life for this oath to be available. If you have no children, you can get this by never abandoning or killing (or giving the order) a single child of yours instead, and also must have at least one child every 10 years. Failing any of these conditions instantly makes you lose all powers permanently. Gain Power Word with all modifiers.

objects.title: Speak As He
objects.text: It was the Father that weaved language and speech into existence, an echo of those who live, a form of meaning that is empty and void, yet still endures, without polluting existence with mass or life bound for suffering. You must master a new language every 40 years. Languages cannot be casually made up; they must come from a sophisticated and sufficiently storied culture to count. As a bonus, your mind cannot lose skills in languages from this moment on. Cannot be assisted by magic. This must be a comprehensive understanding of the language and its writing systems, at the level of a particularly literate native, as such works of literature and culture must also be consumed and understood by you. Learning multiple languages pushes this time limit further into the future, e.g: learning and mastering 3 languages in 10 years means you have 110 years available where you do not need to learn a new one. Failing this makes you lose 30SP, randomly selected, until you learn 30 new languages. Gain 4SP or 1 Perk.
Gain 1 Perk instead of the 4 Maximum Soul potential

rows.title: Karac, Death Bringer
rows.titleText: Some Sons seem to take greater pleasure in the process of bringing entropy than the end itself, and none take bringing violent deaths to others than Karac, the brutal warlord at the helm of a multiversal, nomadic army, focused exclusively on destruction. This eternal adversary of the Hound of Conquest is the most violent and bloodthirsty of all Sons, a veritable monster that has snuffed countless worlds. His oaths force you into conflict, in exchange for more power, for death does not come quietly to the strong.

objects.title: Eternal Ravager
objects.text: Death must be brought through force, the supremacy of raw might. You must wipe out all sentient life in a planet or plane of your choice for every 100 Planeswalks you use, unable to jump if you have not fulfilled this. You can stack up these events, e.g: 2 planets would let you Planeswalk 200 times. These planets must be from reasonably magically empowered dimensions with sentient beings with sizeable populations, so Earth would not count, as these are measured by total amount of souls. You cannot bypass these limitations by having others use planeswalking abilities for you, or through exploits such as purposefully dying while using Phylacteries with Link. Gain Physical Empowerment.

objects.title: Merciless
objects.text: Those who live by the blade, die by it. If you bring suffering upon others, you must be strong enough to hold to that right, otherwise you're uppity cattle, begging to be culled. Beings who have a maxed-out Feast of Evil multiplier (unrelated to the Father) must be attacked on sight with the intent to kill them, unable to stop yourself from doing this. You cannot hold friendships or alliances with them. Being far away, but aware of their existence, does not force you to actively attack them, nor are you required to pursue them. If you fail to do this, servants of the Hound will attack you on sight, and relentlessly pursue you when encountered. Requires Feast of Evil. Gain 1 Perk and 3SP.

rows.title: Petros, The Still
rows.titleText: Petros is one of the most beloved of all Sons, not only amongst them, but even holding some begrudging respect from enemies of the Father. One of the oldest Sons, he attempts to bring a gentle repose to all he brings death to, but only delivering this end while striving to give the worlds he visits a happy and dignified end, slowly draining their lives into his heavenly Sanctum. He's no pushover, however, as he's one of the mightiest spellcasters amongst Sons, a veritable master of the arcane, amongst the greatest in existence.

objects.title: Gentle Ward
objects.text: Entropy is gentle repose, but there's no reason for the lead to it to be full of suffering, goodwill, and positive intent proof of the Father's love. You must strive to make your Sanctum a place of repose, peace and happiness for the souls that dwell inside. Failing to do this wil have you lose your reward, and will double the cost of all spells. You can reclaim your reward once more (and invalidate the penalty) if you hold your Oath for 100 years without failing. You cannot torture or abuse souls inside your Sanctum. You can still keep them as wisps or consume them without facing any penalties. You gain great respect amongst servants of the Mother. Gain Arcane Magic.

objects.title: Benevolent Elder
objects.text: They are children, much like you are to the Father. It is a sign of greatness to be magnanimous to those that are new to this world. You cannot directly and willingly harm infants or give orders to do so. You gain great respect amongst servants of the Hound. Gain either Soul Magic or Necromancy, with all modifiers.
Gain Soul Magic with all modifiers.
Gain Necromancy with all modifiers.

rows.title: He Who Pursues
rows.titleText: Many Sons are consumed by the allure of souls belonging to powerful beings, to acquire ever greater, grander ones, their glimmer, taste, very essence, prizes to lovingly treasure. The delicious nature of these superior souls is too addictive to some Sons. For He Who Pursues, it is the hunt itself that holds value, not the prize. He has been hunting mighty entities for longer than most beings can imagine, and his power is so great that to be targeted by him is to already be dead. Nothing seems to interest him more than this, except perhaps worship of the Father, to whom he offers the greatest souls he acquires.

objects.title: Tribute
objects.text: You are a being built for a purpose, a disciple, warrior, hunter, and servant. You must offer every 50 years the Soul of a mighty being, such as a powerful Demon Lord or great Demiurge, to the Father. You gift these souls directly, as such you cannot use them, your tribute fully taken by entropy. Multiple souls push this time limit further, eg: 3 great souls given as tribute would means that you do not need to offer a tribute for 150 years. Gain Spirit Armor with all modifiers, as well as the Empower modifier for Soul Drain.

objects.id: He spoke to You That Day
objects.title: He spoke to You That Day
objects.text: When He came to you, as you were born, he called you Son, nothing else. Names are false, empty things, callously uttered by the living. The Father has no name, he is simply Him. What makes you worthy of one, if even He has no name? Give up your name. You may no longer hold a name, and you forget the one you once had. You may be called by epithets and titles, but never by a name. This limits certain usages of spoken spells and Power Word altered abilities, and you must use magic creatively to get around this drawback. Gain Reap with all modifiers, as well as the Invisible and Drain Life modifiers for Soul Drain.

rows.title: DRAWBACKS
rows.titleText:
Your new, but deep, knowledge of your soul and its unique properties allows you to tamper with it, as the nascent source of death magic inside it allows you to acquire even more power, at the expense of certain properties and innate advantages that your spirit possesses. Unless stated otherwise, Drawbacks trump all Powers and Perks. The only power that can trump them consistently is Walk Blessed. There may be ways to work around Drawbacks, but they are generally impossible to negate or diminish completely, as they're inherent to your very essence.

Some give Soul Points for a stronger Start while others give Maximum Soul Potential for stronger Endgame.

objects.title: Limited Capacity
objects.text: Place a limit on your infinity. You may now only hold the equivalent of 10.000.000.000 human souls.

objects.title: Inneficient Usage
objects.text: Your synergy with Entropy is staggered. All your spells cost 25% more souls than before.

objects.title: Diminished Production
objects.text: Cripple the expansion of your soul. You now only generate the equivalent of one * a day.

objects.title: Holy Weakness
objects.text: Become vulnerable like lesser entropic beings. Holy magic is now terribly effective against you and your spells. This does not extend to minions or Gifts.
+1 for having Diminished Production
+1 for having Inneficient Usage

objects.title: Dead Senses
objects.text:
Entropy brings death to your senses. You may not mimic these senses through magic; they are intrinsically dead to you. May be taken multiple times. 
Touch, hearing and sight are worth 2 choices here, taste or speech only 1 for +4SP for each choice.

objects.title: Incompatible Target
objects.text: Limit the breadth of your harvests. Choose any of the following soul types: humanoid, draconic, spirits, animalistic, monstrous, divine. You cannot take any souls belonging to any creature that belongs to any of these groups. May be taken multiple times.

objects.title: Disloyalty
objects.text: 10% of your created minions have free will and are not beholden to you in any way. You cannot affect them with minion related magic and cannot dismiss them. You instantly know which minions are disloyal.

objects.title: Apocalypse
objects.text: The stench of your planet has awakened the ire of something that is even beyond a god of destruction. Your world will end. In 5 years' time, an Origin Dragon, the most powerful of its kind, will arrive into your dimension and destroy your planet. Find a way to escape by then.

objects.title: Elemental Weakness
objects.text: Your soul becomes incompatible with an element. Choose one of: Earth, Wind, Fire. You're now weak to these elements when imbued with magic, though not as vulnerable as you'd be against Holy magic had you taken Holy Weakness. Cannot be taken for elements that you have chosen for Elemental Simulacrum. May be taken multiple times.

objects.title: Lonely
objects.text:
Chosen once: only 1 Gift of your choise still loves you.
Chosen twice: Are they truly gifts anymore? Your Gifts will no longer hold affection towards you. While they will still be loyal and may in time come to respect you, they will never truly love you. Forcing yourself on them will make them despise you intensely.

objects.title: Strife
objects.text: Untempered obsession. Your Gifts are unwilling to share you. They will fight, sabotage, and backstab each other just to keep you all to themselves. They are unable to cooperate and will require direct supervision to avoid infighting. Requires 2 Gifts or more.
