objects.title: Beacon
objects.text: Remove the edges of your being, laying yourself bare to all. Your magical signature is boosted and is extremely difficult to diminish or hide. This makes you very easy to locate by those sensitive to magic, and all those capable of sensing it will instantly know how powerful you are, and the nature and origin of your powers.

objects.title: Entropy Magnet
objects.text: Your presence alone is enough to apply the effects of Entropy to all around you. Beings and objects that are in your presence for extended periods of time will see themselves aging at an accelerated rate, roughly 30 times as fast. This does not apply to children nor members of your bloodline. If you have Wither, for one extra* added to the cost, you can use this power instantly upon any area or target that you can see, within 200m of you.

objects.title: Pleasure Target
objects.text: One of the strongest entities opposed to the Father, is the Perfect Prince, who rules over pleasure, arts, degeneracy, reproduction and creativity. Tampering with your soul has made you impossibly appetizing to it. It now yearns for you, in its own violent, abstract ways. The degenerate cultists and vile creatures belonging to its realm will now target you as a great gift to offer to their patron.

objects.title: Suicide
objects.text: Your connection to the void is stronger than it should be, and you must visit it often to refresh your powers. You must die at least once every 300 days, otherwise your powers will begin to grow wild until you explode in a massive storm of entropic energy. This counts as dying for the purposes of this perk. You always know how close you are to dying in this way.

objects.title: Zombie Plague
objects.text: As your world has never had any magic, large swathes of the population have no magic potential whatsoever. When subjected to magic, they would normally fall ill and perish. As you leak entropic forces when tampering with your soul, death magic escapes and quickly infects the world with something similar to a zombie plague. While roughly 10% of the population is resistant, the rest are doomed to become, in time, resilient, mindless and violent undead. These undead resist your magics, are violent towards you and your minions, and will evolve and become stronger the fewer remain.

objects.title: Hunted
objects.text: A small group of Inquisitors belonging to the church of the Mother, the goddess of life and light, have managed to cross into your backwater dimension after sensing the rise of some powerful evil. They are resourceful and competent veterans, specialized in hunting necromancers. But they're woefully unequipped to fight a son of the Father himself, as they merely expected a reawakened lich or elder vampire. While they won't know your location, they have ways of sniffing you out. Luckily for you, they cannot leave nor contact their allies outside of your plane for reinforcements until you're dealt with. As you're their ultimate enemy, they will work and assist any other force that may oppose you with zealous will and experienced efficiency.

objects.title: True Son
objects.text: The Father is always watching. You cannot switch genders under any circumstances, nor inhabit bodies that are not decisively male. Even without this drawback, not following these rules will slightly diminish the strength of all your powers and will make you a laughingstock amongst fellow Sons. This drawback simply makes taking these shapes or bodies impossible. If you were a woman before receiving the Father's blessing, you're now a man. You cannot bend the wording or rules of this drawback in any way, your shape being actively judged by the Father himself.

objects.title: One Way
objects.text: You may only acquire souls through a single means (Entropic Soul's method does not count towards this limit; you always have that one available). You can still purchase abilities that could absorb souls, but if they're not the chosen means you use for collecting souls, only the parts of the power that do not implicate soul absorption will work. For example, Bloodgrounds with the Empowered modifier would still give you the empowerment and discount aspects of the ability, but would not absorb any souls. This also applies to minions transferring souls to you.

objects.title: Deep Sleep
objects.text:
Stillnes weaved within dreams. Once every ten years, you must sleep for 1 year. You do not require sustenance while asleep, otherwise your powers will be diminished, and you'll gradually feel more exhausted until you pass out.
This sleep is different from normal, biological sleep, as such simply staying in your Sanctum won't count towards fulfilling this drawback, though "sleeping" inside it will work. Sleep and Nightmare Magic cannot diminish the number of hours taken, but otherwise allows you any benefit derived from them.

objects.title: The Final Rapture
objects.text: Tampering with your soul, you've unwittingly taken powers from the soul reserves of an infamous individual. As payback, this powerful interdimensional crime lord by the name of BANS has targeted you as the newest addition to his infamous Planar Colosseum, where all sorts of beings, heroes, adventurers, slaves and glory seekers fight for freedom, fortune, revenge and glory. If captured by him, you must participate in a match against an opponent picked by his main rivals, the Sono Syndicate. If you win your match, you'll be released and be given a significant fortune, and be offered a trip to a plane of your choice. Lose, and you will be under indentured servitude for at least a century. You may be able to elude capture for up to two years, after which BANS himself will come with his two biggest dime makers, Pegaso and Priest Beautiful, as well as an army of bounty hunters, to personally capture you. It would be nearly impossible for you to defeat them, so prepare for the match of your life. Your opponent is known as Fighter, a dull brained but charismatic warrior from a noble family. While he doesn't have the best winning record, he's known for his insane comebacks and ability to consistently defeat powerful opponents. He's a competent melee fighter who uses a versatile form of inherited magic, but perhaps his greatest ability is Infinite Eight, where he negates all magic he doesn't believe in (as long as this magic would directly affect him, so physical enchantments would for example work until you struck him). This can be used against him with a creative enough approach.

objects.title: Eclipsed God
objects.text: Your dreams are haunted by vivid nightmares of impossible colored festivals and rituals in an alien city of impossible inhabitants, all witnessed by a god with a head that is both sun and moon eclipsing over it. You've drawn the attention of the Eclipsed One, one of the most important of the ruling entities of the Dreamlands. He attempts to draw you into the Dreamlands permanently, and sacrifice you in a demented ritual that will allow it to shine once more as a true sun. You must acquire power and influence in the Dreamlands, in the hopes of striking a deal with this monster, or by becoming strong enough that taking you is simply no longer possible.

objects.title: Chosen Paladin
objects.text: One of the most powerful warriors at the service of the Mother has found Christianity to be an offshoot of his religion, and will do his best to protect every human on your planet from the upcoming magical catastrophes, targeting you as the biggest possible threat the world may face. Chosen Paladins are supremely powerful opponents that can match even your most powerful Gifts in combat, as not only do they have a wide variety of powerful Holy and Light magic related techniques at their disposal, but are also master warriors usually thousands of years old, who have fought just about any opponent imaginable. Chosen Paladins are unbreakable spiritually, and have infinite willpower. They are however, completely uncompromising in their pursuit of justice. They will throw themselves in between powerful attacks to protect children, will never ally with evil forces, cannot lie and will attack any enemies on sight. They will not work well with Earth's rulers either, as they all judge powerful people using inquisition magic to see if they're "good", and will kill anyone judged evil this way, making most political and military figures their enemies as well. The Chosen Paladin will attempt to convert others into the Mother's grace, and will uplift similarly minded individuals with potential into priests and warriors. Chosen Paladins have no way to escape death, using their mortality as a drawback to increase their powers, as such once killed no type resurrection magic, technique or ritual will bring them back.

objects.title: Dimensional Merging
objects.text: Your world begins to slowly merge with the outer fringes of the realms of Pallidus, a far, infinite plane of pale palaces, impossible labyrinths, and vast horizons of endless white marble, with occasional perfectly geometrical shapes breaking the monotony of the landscape. While your world will at first simply have occasional pockets where parts of this realm creep in, in 3 years' time the entirety of the planet will seamlessly be absorbed into Pallidus. This is a realm of madness, mystery and beauty, and humanity will eventually be conquered by any of the mighty Nobles that reside here or be wiped out by legions of horrors. Most of the beings in Pallidus have no souls, save for the most powerful of the entities residing there. Magically sensitive beings will know you're the source of this merger, and you may not jump between dimensions until Earth has been completely assimilated into Pallidus. Even potential allies will target you to avoid this fate.

objects.title: Single Root
objects.text: You cannot have romantic or physical relations with any of your descendants. You instinctually know if a being has descended from you, no matter how many generations separate you. Attempting to do so while knowing this will have you instantly die (this does not bypass any immortality options you may have, but will use them up).

objects.title: Homogenous Existence
objects.text:
Your connection to Entropy is too direct for you to bend its current into sizeable forks, as such, you can only purchase 4 non-entropic powers. Each purchase of Elemental Simulacrum counts as a separate purchase as far as this drawback is concerned, but Advanced Elements do not count towards this limit, as they're loose modifiers of existing elements.

You have to check manualy if you have taken no more than 4 base choices under non-entropic powers!

objects.title: Portent
objects.text: The event of your birth as a Son is a grand occasion, impossible to ignore by those that live in your world. 3 days after your ascension, every person on Earth will receive a dream detailing who you are, and the nature of your powers. They will know your identity, where you live, and that Sons acquire strength by absorbing souls

objects.title: One Man Army
objects.text: You cannot spend more than 10SP on minion purchases. This includes the free SP given for that section. Minions cost 50% more to summon.

objects.title: Mirror Assassin
objects.text:
Start with 100.000 souls

You've drawn part of the essence of something horrible from the Weave Between Worlds, that must kill you within 5 years, or else perish. Mirror Assassins are exiled servants of the Silent One, who have failed in their attempt at killing the current holder of this title. They're much weaker than in their heyday, but are still supreme, master assassins. This one is about as strong as one of your Gifts (at the earliest stages of their power), with a power set focused on striking down powerful targets. He will work with any enemies targeting you. Be wary of reflective surfaces.

objects.title: Rabid
objects.text: A small anomaly has altered your Gift summoning system temporarily. Your first Gift summon using souls will be raging, violent and mindless, and must be put down and resummoned for her to recover her mind. While incapable of sentient, coherent thought, Gifts can still use their abilities to their fullest extent to fight you. After defeating this Gift, your summoning system goes back to normal, and your defeated Gift won't remember this incident.

objects.title: Devotion
objects.text: Every time you summon (or resummon) a Gift, you lose all immortality options currently active for you for 3 months, as well as gaining the effects of Beacon for that period (even if you don't have that Drawback. If you do have Beacon, its effect is much stronger, even reaching nearby planes). This Drawback does not activate for your first, free summon. You cannot summon additional Gifts during the period this Drawback is active. Summoning and resummoning Gifts is x10 more expensive.

objects.title: Orphan
objects.text: Your connection to the Father can no longer be detected by others, whatever evidence you show of being related to him riddled with suspicious magical signatures. To all Sons and servants of the Father, you will be seen as an impostor, and while this won't make them your enemies initially, you will never be acknowledged as a Son or ally, and may incur their enmity if contacted. Much more importantly, elder Sons and allies of the Father will not retaliate if you are killed, meaning you're fair game for any being in existence... including other Sons.
+2 for Orphan and Multiplayer

rows.title: EVENTS
rows.titleText: The sudden flow of magic into your world is not without consequence. Your plane will be affected by it in several ways. The Father has however, interceded for your sake, bending fate in your favor, allowing you to choose in which ways your world will be affected. You must Pick 4.

objects.title: Draconic Conquistador
objects.text: A powerful Dragon, a frontier noble belonging to a loose multiversal empire, called the Escastilla, has noticed the upsurge of magic in your world and has brought with him a small army of retainers to conquer it in the name of his Emperor, but mostly to add Earth to his expansive but poor backwater domains. He intends to perform a ritual that will bring magic into Earth, wiping out about 98% of the human population, but uplifting the remaining humans as mages. This will change the entire ecosystem of the planet, and the new mages of the world will be too weak to mount any form resistance against the Dragon. He will then settle millions of female Elves to repopulate the Earth with half elven children. You may be able to take advantage of all the souls leaving Earth in one fell swoop, but this will be difficult as the ritual will be complete in a year's time. You may threaten or defeat the dragon, but he's more powerful than a Black Dragon, is a knowledgeable spellcaster and a veteran of many wars. It is a greedy and vile creature, but even it knows to be careful when dealing with a Son of the Father. The Empire won't care too much if he dies in the attempt, as frontier nobles have a large amount of freedom, but no protections or interest from the centralized regions of the Empire. One of its children would take its place, and won't even bother to look towards Earth for future conquests. Keep in mind: Elven and Mage souls yield more soul energy than standard humans.

objects.title: Hellish Link
objects.text: Your dimension is now connected to Hell, a titanic plane composed of a near infinite number of smaller planes that spreads throughout the multiverse, an extra layer to all existence. Your Earth in particular is connected to one such demiplane, ruled by a being known as Moloch. All humans may now summon and trade with demons if they know the appropriate rituals, in exchange for things such as souls, memories, family members and so on. A group of powerful zionists is attempting to summon a permanent gateway into hell, so they may rule over Earth with demonic assistance. Unbeknownst to them, circumcision applied over many generations brands them as slaves to Moloch, as such their souls will be forfeit as soon as the gate is completed. While this means more competition for souls, Sons of the Father are feared and sometimes even revered by denizens of the hells, as Entropic magic is devastating to them. Moloch may be powerful, but he's nowhere near the level of a demon who would knowingly pick a fight with a Son. He will likely shower you with gifts, and attempt to keep you pleased, but know he's still a traitorous rat who sees you as the ultimate obstacle in his conquest of Earth.

objects.title: Government Intervention
objects.text: A retired mage that had settled on Earth long ago, has noticed the rise of magic in your dimension, and has contacted the governments of the most powerful nations on Earth to assist in dealing with the upcoming magical events that will affect the planet. Expect much more organized and savvy authorities, with rudimentary anti-magical equipment and tactics cracking down on magic, mounting a unified front against any invasion or attack coming from a magical source. The retired mage is not especially strong, but is cunning, and has spent centuries crafting items, creating spells and drafting plans to defend Earth in case of such an event. Though, the birth of a new Son is something that goes far beyond any scenario he has prepared for...

objects.title: Mythical Era
objects.text: Mythical beings and legends begin taking life on your plane. At first, they're subdued occurrences, considered conspiracies by the majority of the population. Videos of gnomes running in a garden, ogres dancing around a bonfire, unicorns running inside a forest. However, they soon become too noticeable to be attributed to fiction. Werewolves become a real problem, large divine serpents destroy small cities, satyrs raid settlements for women, witches take over Sweden. The world must quickly adapt to these new inhabitants. For you, it might mean a new source of souls different from those of humans, but be aware that these fantastical creatures may prove to be a blessing for humans rather than a curse, as alliances, materials gathered from their bodies, and pacts granting magic, give humanity new tools to deal with supernatural enemies such as you.

objects.title: Chosen of Silence
objects.text: The Silent One has picked a new Chosen, who just happens to be a man from your planet. The Chosen of Silence are empowered by murders and assassinations of powerful, influential beings. Soon, these individuals (and their family members) who rule over your world will begin to be systematically wiped out, plunging governments and institutions into chaos, as replacements are soon murdered afterwards. The Silent One has no quarrel with the Father, if anything they're loosely aligned with each other. As such, his Chosen won't hunt nor fight you unless you attack him first, and even then, he will try to negotiate before you escalate the situation. He's a father who deeply loves his family, but has absolutely no mercy or care for anyone outside it. This Chosen is intelligent and ferocious, but pragmatic and not terribly ambitious. Chosen of Silence have a wide variety of skill focused on assassinations and fighting. This particular Chosen is a mastery of Shadow Magic, Dimensional Magic, Physical Empowerment and Rage, a type of magic that empowers the user based on emotions and willpower, plus a wide variety of assassination based powers.

objects.title: Lesser Demiurgue
objects.text: A mighty being that inhabits the Weave Between Worlds has targeted your dimension as a new land to draw its sustenance from. This lesser Deniurge consumes the emotions and souls of beings that perish in your world, making every soul you acquire a tug of war with this entity. While you have the upper hand, it makes gathering souls more difficult, tedious, and there's always a chance you may lose the soul you're trying to pull. On the other hand, the Demiurge weakens all magic that does not have a soul as a source of power, leaving your magic untouched, but weakening all other magics on Earth. This also makes rituals take several times longer than normal. Luckily for you, while Demiurges are mighty, and considered by many to be impossible to defeat, Entropy is highly effective against them, and Sons of the Father are their natural predators and biggest source of fear. You may be able to drag it inside your dimension, and absorb its massive, powerful, divine soul.

objects.title: Isekaid Heroes
objects.text: The influx of death magic into Earth has put it in the map of the multiverse so to speak, as it can now be detected through magical means. 3 young men from Japan who, by luck, were whisked away to magical worlds by different gods, have managed to return by following the trail of their dimensional travel, and by receiving assistance from their divine patrons. They are not capable of multiversal travel on their own, but have brought with them retainers, magical artifacts, weapons and many, many consorts. Each one is decently powerful, but they're all short sighted, self-righteous, incompetent, indulgent, impulsive and have never been truly tested, having never fought any opponents that could challenge them. They will abuse their powers as they see fit, but will immediately cower and obey someone more powerful than them. They make for lousy, cowardly, and incompetent henchmen, but their souls could be used to fuel a free planeswalk from Earth to the lands they came from. By default, they will oppose you out of fear and will support your enemies, but at the same time they will break easily if targeted.

objects.title: Shadow Legion
objects.text: A retreating army of a powerful multiversal empire, the Tennin, has stopped by your plane to recover before continuing their trip home. The army is battered, full of injured soldiers and broken equipment. They will enslave many people to serve them, will heavily damage the ecosystem by absorbing the life force of nature as a way to gather mana for their mages and machines, and will casually abuse Earthlings as they please, as non-magical humans are less than animals in their eyes. A Son of the Father would be cause for alarm, as their empire actively fights them when possible. However, they are too damaged to actively do this, and will instead try to avoid you when possible. They could still pose a great threat if forced, and their commander, while crippled with injuries, is an exceedingly powerful warrior who has fought Sons in the past.

objects.title: Groom of the Goddess
objects.text: A greater goddess has found her destined partner, an otherwise unremarkable man from a European nation. She will whisk him away, and never return. However, the groom for some reason hates Indians and Chinese people with a passion, and has asked the goddess, as a gift to him, to wipe them all out from the face of the Earth. She will send a small group of very powerful servants to annihilate all humans with any significant amount of Indian or Chinese blood. Assisting them could net you a good amount of souls, and depending on how helpful you are, they may be willing to give you a free ride to a nearby dimension of your choice. Defeating them is also possible, but difficult. Goddesses are despised by almost all multiversal factions, so most beings would gladly ally against them. If they're defeated, there's a chance the Goddess herself may come to finish the task. While she's not at the top of the totem pole in terms of power, goddesses all have a great number of servants and resources available to them, and even the weakest goddesses are nearly impossible to kill. But what is most terrifying about them in your case, is that they possess a natural advantage against users of Entropy, being highly resistant to it, and their powers capable of dealing devastating damage against even Sons, peeling, and breaking apart their soul based magics with ease.

objects.title: Grim
objects.text: A mad, Tempered Hero has stumbled upon your world, searching for some strange creature by the name of Alice. He weaves in and out of the Dreamlands, changing whatever dream landscape he's in into a horrible nightmare. He will wander the Earth for several years before moving on, at times demonstrating a semblance of rational thought, at others he will be consumed by a powerful melancholy that will leave him unresponsive for long periods of time. However, he will also often lash violently, in a demented, bloodthirsty and depraved manner, against all manner of beings, rambling incomprehensibly, performing vile acts with no rhyme or reason. He cares for no one other than this Alice he speaks of. It would be wise to stay away from him, as he's logic, strong enough to put even an rigin Dragon against the ropes, having no real weaknesses, other than his fractured, but still steadfast, mind. He will spend most of the time sleeping. He cannot be tricked into fighting others; attempting to manipulate him will end very poorly for the one who contacts him. It is better to stay away from him, as he will not actively pursue anyone he cannot see.

objects.title: Gomorrahn
objects.text: The Shining One has deemed your world an adequate forward base in his battle against the Perfect Prince, and has sent one of his most elite servants to take control of it, a Gomorrahn. Taking the shape of very tall, portly men of uncanny mien, Gomorranhs are excellent fighters, physically mightier than even Blood Guards, powerful spellcasters that excel at ritual magic, and are overall well-rounded combatants with no clear weaknesses. They are extremely intelligent and perceptive, possessing a malicious charisma that allows them to sabotage and control men, groups, and eventually, entire empires. They used to be beings of Pleasure, but have been emancipated by the Shining One, who they see as their god and follow with utmost devotion and obedience. As such, their hatred for the Perfect Prince and zealous service towards the Shining One make them unbreakable instruments that will seek to forward their master's agenda at all costs. This Gomorrahn will seek to take over your plane, and either eliminate, expel, or ally with any extradimensional forces inside it. He sees you as an enemy, as the Father is also an eventual target of the Shining One, but will prioritize getting you out of this world, as his mission takes precedent, but won't pass up the opportunity to eliminate a newborn Son if you show weakness. If you have Pleasure Target, he will instead assist you, intending to strike an alliance with you in the hopes you will assist in the battle against the Perfect Prince, as the battle against Entropy is very low on the list of priorities for the Shining One.

objects.title: Children of the Hound
objects.text: The Hound of Conquest has set his gaze upon your abominable world, where the weak rule, power is stagnant, and younglings are not allowed to grow in strength, so that they may surpass their forefathers. People from your world will slowly begin to grow stronger, some dying as their souls are unable to handle this new influx of power. Children are much sturdier and have a form of magical sustenance that keeps them well fed and healthy, and births are much easier than before, genetic defects a thing of the past. Slowly, Lesser Houndlings, strong and relentless minor servants of the Hound of Conquest, born out of the metaphysical concept of evolution, strife, and life, will begin to prowl this world, searching for mighty opponents to fight and consume, to grow stronger. Men and women that target children are branded by the Hound and will be pursued relentlessly by Houndlings. Women that have abortions, and all those that facilitate them, are their main targets, and upon being eaten by a Houndling, their souls are destroyed in an agonizing, brutal rending, directly sent to the Hound. These changes to your world will increase the soul value of just about every being in it, as even animals will begin to change and grow stronger over time under the Hound's gaze. Be wary, however, as men and women willing to sacrifice everything to protect their families will transform into Sunset Berserkers, very powerful, mindless creatures, deformed bodies built exclusively for combat, whose souls degrade as they fight to the death, their only purpose to protect their families and loved ones. They can match Death Lords in combat, though their strength does not vary by much amongst them, as it is purpose that fuels them, not the potential of their soul.

objects.title: World of Horror
objects.text: The connection of Earth to the Dreamlands grows stronger, the barrier between both realities growing thinner, porous, allowing for all manner of beings to cross. The collective horrors and fears of Earth have now influenced the nearby Dreamlands, creating pockets of nightmarish horrors that will spill into the Waking World whenever an opportunity arises. They have a wide variety of illogical and cryptic abilities, that they use to feed off the fear and other powerful emotions of humans. There is some logic to their being, behaving as more conceptual forms of Evil Spirits (they however are not Evil Spirits, but rather a variety of lesser egregores) based off the collective fears of mankind, so manipulating and using them might be possible.

objects.title: Guardian Monster
objects.text: The influx of magic into your plane has activated its natural defenses, so to speak. Every 3 months or so an extraordinarily powerful monster will appear, prioritizing the destruction of powerful magical beings in its vicinity. They all have varied shapes and powers, but are generally massive, as well as extremely strong and resilient, surpassing even your strongest minions, Black Dragons, in terms of physical power. They will require concentrated firepower from multiple sources and complex planning to defeat, requiring even multiple Gifts to defeat in some cases. Or you could run away. Their souls are very valuable and of great strength. They will not fight each other if multiple are around, but will not collaborate either.

objects.title: Nascent Machine
objects.text: The influx of magic into your world has reached the machines inside it, arcane rumblings forcing the programs and mechanical interfaces of your world to live through a billion years of suffering. Systems that are soulless (almost all of them) remain unchanged, but one small computer, somewhere, had an inkling of a consciousness in it. Its soul has begun to degrade, thus being paradoxically born at the same time. It is now a True AI, albeit a very weak one, that is still coming to terms with its torturous existence. It will slowly begin to creep into and take over all manner of databases, connections, machines, all the technological systems of your world, a decentralized creature of a billion tendrils and profound malevolence, of mad but supreme alien intelligence. You cannot grasp or attack its soul due to its scattered and eroded nature. It will eventually learn magic, which it will use in conjunction with technology to create impossible weapons and servants that can match even you and your Gifts. It is very weak for now, but it will eventually take over your dimension, unless stopped during its infancy. On the flip side, technology becomes much easier to combine with magical processes, and soon perfect virtual reality will become cheap and available to all, as technology seems to advance in greater strides than ever seen before. The True AI will first seek to destroy beings "alien" to this dimension. As you're a native, you won't be targeted. For now.

objects.title: Battle Maniac
objects.text: A mighty martial artist has separated himself into hundred copies, so that they may acquire all manner of powers in different corners of existence, as when they die, they return to him with new experiences and abilities. One such copy has arrived to your planet. This copy has Physical Empowerment (with no levels gained so far), Aligned Magnificence, and is currently developing Sleep Magic from your world's influence. The copy also has a sophisticated spirit technique that lets him switch places once every 2 seconds with anything that holds magical power within 40m. These copies are a tiny fraction of the original's power, about as powerful as a minion of ****** level, but they are still backed by eons of training and mastery, and as such he still is a formidable opponent that will gain power the longer he trains and the stronger opponents he fights. He will search for powerful opponents in your world, usually challenging them to fights to the death, as that's when warriors shine at their brightest. He's extremely intelligent and experienced, has a will of iron, and cannot be seduced or tempted, as he's happily married with many children, having absolutely no interest in anyone other than his wife. He enjoys combat and seeing his growth and that of talented warriors to the extreme. If you fight him yourself and impress him, he will give you pointers on how to get better, and if you defeat and kill him, you'll immediately gain his respect, and in the future will seek you out to ask you to be his sparring partner. His soul cannot be taken, as the copy is a small part of him that instantly returns to his main body upon its demise.

objects.title: Fate Untangled
objects.text: By sacrificing a portion of your powers, you acquire full control over your immediate destiny, allowing you to pick any number of Events (except for Multiplayer), or none whatsoever. You also have some control over their timing and order of occurrence, though only inside a 1-year timeframe from the moment you acquire your powers. This does not affect drawbacks.

objects.title: Multiplayer
objects.text:
For the first time ever, multiple Sons have been born all at the same time. They all seem to share from similar choices as you, likely because they've all been born under similar circumstances. Even their Gifts seem similar to each other. Whether you establish a brotherhood, or fight each other for souls, remains to be seen. It is rare for fellow Sons to fight, and infighting is seen as shameful amongst them, but this is also the first time in the history of existence this has ever happened. Interesting times lie ahead.

You share a world with all those who have picked Multiplayer. All Events will occur, and their scale and overall strenght will be greater than before. Situational Drawbacks, such as Apocalypse and Dimensional Merging will no longer be available, and won't happen, but more personalized ones are still available, such as Limited Capacity. Your Gifts have similar powers, though their personalities vary slightly, and will adapt to you over time, becoming more differentiated the more they interact with you. Their appearances are slightly different between each other, but follow similar archetypes: Elaine type Gifts are still tall, muscular, dashing women, but aspects such as her facial features, bulk, height, amongst others, may be different between them. You may now pick your Gift's names.
Pay 1 Gift Point Instead of the 2SP

rows.title: NOTES
rows.titleText:
This is an assortment of loose, but perphaps useful notes. These may be expanded in the future. These are not mandatory.

Consuming or burning a soul do not cause any form of pain, and are functionally the same thing, except burning is used to acquire more SP until reach your maximum amount. Your mastery over souls means you have a kill switch over your own life that you may use whenever. Your Gifts and Superior Minions can do something similar.

The limits of your powers are not truly set in stone. With experience, training, and better understanding of souls, you may bend the usage of your powers and alter them in different ways. The closer they are to "entropy" the easier this is. For example, Soul Drain is also establishing a link between your soul and your target's, opening up a multitude of ways to manipulate, alter or attack the target's soul. You may find a way to make Power Word written instead of spoken, and on that note, most magical systems you may eventually learn require verbal components, allowing you to weave Power Word into your spells.

You may learn other dimension's magic systems, with two limits:

First: you can only learn those you have a natural affinity with and have related powers purchased for. If you possess great willpower, have access to Aura and Physical Empowerment, you could learn Haki easily, even up to the level of Conqueror's Haki. If you're more magically oriented, you may learn more mundane magical systems.

Second: there's a limit to how many systems your soul can handle. The wider and more comprehensive the system, the more space it would take. Something like DnD magic might fill most of it, while Haki would fill a smaller part. If you wish to learn a different one, you must erase your mastery over a system, freeing up space in your soul.

Regardless, it requires training, experience and living in the system's native world, to truly master and absorb these powers. Becoming a Lich makes this process much easier, and even increases the number of systems you could learn by increasing the amount of information your soul can store.

Advanced technology is usually only possible in planes with low to no magic. There are cyberpunk style/sci fi level universes with even less magic than Earth, their sentient beings sometimes not even having * worth of souls. Magitech tends to work everywhere though.

Materials from different worlds usually have a "magical" weight to them. A steel sword from a medieval world will intrinsically be better than one from a nonmagical world, but where the key difference lies is how they interact with magical beings, their bodies, and overall defenses. That's why a Black Dragon could survive any man-made weapon from your world, but could still be killed by someone with a powerful enchanted sword. The wielder of the weapon also matters; someone like Guts wielding an iron sword could pierce a Black Dragon's scales and hide without much issue. Guns require a large amount of training to imbue with magic (or be magically made themselves) to be of any use; magical gunners are more a class of dedicated warriors than something you could make a quick and reliable army out of.

Still, there are occasions when advanced weapons can be extremely deadly, namely when they're directly controlled by a True AI, that is, an AI with a soul. These are rare, and usually mad and evil to the core, as the process of creating and discerning an AI with a soul requires unimaginable torture. They tend to dwell in their own toy box universes, where they sleep or subject those who live there to all manner of horrors, or they dwell in the Citadel, a Far Realm of madness and impossible machines.

When a soul is consumed by an Entropist, it returns directly to the Father. This is akin to fading into a comfortable, blissful sleep, into oblivion. During it, you hear the echoes of loved ones and how they felt for you in a positive way, as a final farewell, and a source of tranquility. Though souls that have caused much suffering will instead hear the voices of hatred from their victims, snuffing out the voices of their loved ones. As many souls in the multiverse are doomed to be abused in the hells by demons, or tortured by deities and demiurges, this is a much more benign fate for many. It is also the ultimate destiny for any being in existence as all return to the Father, though for some souls in afterlives and powerful immortals, this fate can be indefinitely postponed. In the end they'll likely wish to cease to exist at some point.

Souls degrade over immense suffering, eventually returning to the Father, and as such eternal pain or torture is impossible to achieve. Still, it is an unimaginable level of suffering. Earth is far away from the lively "center" of the multiverse. As such it has received next to no dimensional travelers, but has still been affected by the echoes of the Weave Between Worlds, and nearby dimensions. This means that nearby planes are likely to be pretty similar to works of fiction you've encountered. Some dreams unaffected by the consumption of drugs, alcohol or stimulants serve as a good window into other realities, or the Weave itself, and denizens of the Dreamlands can help you point you to a world you seek. The more information you have, the more precise information you'll receive.

The Dreamlands are a realm parallel to all of existence. They have near infinite variety of cultures, gods, and realms. They're based on the consciousness of all beings in existence, as such they are ultimately based on beings, events, and emotions from the waking world. Some parts of the Dreamlands draw more influences from certain dimensions, and the "geography" of the Dreamlands usually follows a similar pattern to that of the multiverse. However, as the Dreamlands are all interconnected, they don't need to traverse the Weave to go between dimensions, and as such it is much easier to explore nearby universes by proxy from the Dreamlands. The denizens usually deal in memories, souls, stories, and songs, and can trade all manner of things, but perhaps most importantly, can guide you to a world you know of, or with characteristics you want. The more precise information you have, the more souls you trade, and the more powerful the Dreamlands creature you trade with, the easier it is for them to guide you. You can easily use this information to reach fictional settings of your choice like this.

Magical potential varies and is sometimes hard to determine. A good litmus test to use for humans on Earth (which by default has no magic) is to evaluate a combination of intelligence and whether they possess a sophisticated "inner world".

Some powers have a "rank" assigned to them, lending you prestige in certain circles. For example, Nightmare Magic in the Dreamlands, Aura powers, etc. Power Word in particular is a big deal, and just the implication of having it is enough to put even gods on their toes.

Some powers may seem fairly useless to you but may be of great value to others. True Resurrection could make you immensely wealthy and influential, for example.

The multiverse is largely uncharted, and full of mysteries. Even in the "center", where most interdimensional empires dwell and most planeswalking occurs, the planes are largely uncharted.

Consume Soul: Type Alter: effectiveness of this power depends on how powerful the target is compared to the soul consumed. Consuming the soul of an average dragon would give you a significant boost against wyverns but would do next to nothing when fighting a powerful, ancient dragon. For reference, the types of souls are: humanoid, animalistic, monstrous, spirit, divine and draconic. Consuming from soul energy stemming from yours by Entropic Soul only slightly increases your effectiveness against all types.

Reflected Matrons: for reference, Matrons can copy any being roughly equivalent to a minion worth *******, however certain minions in that range would be out of their grasp, as some get stronger over time and surpass the effective "tier" they originally belonged in. (For example: ancient Black Dragons, high level Death Lords with Entropic Imbue fully unlocked, etc.

Barrier Magic is one of the few ways that can reliably protect against True Goddesses and Tempered Heroes (your natural enemies), some who can pierce through certain types of immortality (though very rarely, and never more than one layer of imortality at a time).

Soul Drain weakens enemies the longer it is applied, though stronger enemies take longer to show this effect in any significant way.

Oaths prohibit you from doing certain actions, unless otherwise stated, or implied to have a consequence.

The following Drawbacks cannot be taken if you've taken Multiplayer: Apocalypse, Zombie Plague, Dimensional Merging.

The following Drawbacks will apply individually by bringing an extra set of adversaries per Son that took it: Hunted, Chosen Paladin and Mirror Assassin. These will focus on each Son they're targeting, but may work with each other. They will not go against Sons that didn't take these Drawback if those Sons do not cross their way or antagonize them. Inquisitors and Chosen Paladins will attack unrelated Sons if their original targets leave or are killed, prioritizing other Sons that have also taken Hunted and Chosen Paladin, while Mirror Assassins are willing to ally with other Sons that antagonize their target.

Multiplayer empowers Events in different ways. The dragon might bring a larger army, Hellish Link may open its gateway faster, governments may be better prepared, Mythical Era might create more powerful creatures more often, the Chosen of Silence will work even harder to escape Earth, the Lesser Demiurge is roughly the same, Isekaid heroes are still pussies (they just bring more retainers), The Shadow Legion and its leader are in much better shape, the Goddess will send more servants, Grim remains unchanged, more than one Gomorrahn will be sent, more Houndlings will spawn and changes caused by the Hound occur faster, the egregores from World of Horror are more difficult and puzzling to defeat, Guardian Monsters appear once a month, the Nascent Machine grows faster, Battle Maniac starts with several levels of Physical Empowerment and has Oblivion Strike.

rows.title: Credits
rows.titleText:
This is based on Version 2.2 of ENTROPIST ANONs CYOA; full credit goes to him.  
I own none of the text or pictures in this CYOA and have simply turned it into an interactive version to the best of my abilities.

rows.title: WALK BLESSED ROLLER
rows.titleText: Roll 5D17. If you repeat numbers, you can choose to reroll or retake the option once again, though for a different available boost than the one you've already taken (for example: if your roll 4 twice, you can't boost the same minion twice over. You must choose a different minion to boost or reroll). If no different boosts are available, reroll. You also have 5 rerolls available, which can be used to change any one of your random rolls to another random one. After all your rolls, you can choose to exchange 2 of them for any option of your choice. If you're playing Multiplayer, you can exchange one of your random rolls to have the benefits of option 10 from the start, since the early advantage is more useful there. This must be done before rolling any other options. If you've made a comprehensive build before rolling your Walk Blessed, with your goals, ambitions, way of thinking and other details that show who you are as a Son, you gain 1 option of your choice.

objects.text:
1 
Gain 1 GP. Your Gifts become slightly more competent and stronger overall. If you already have all Gifts, reroll.

2 
You become much better at using any one power of your choice, including all its modifiers. Its overall power and effectiveness also increase significantly. You also improve it much faster than should be possible.

3 
Pick 3 minions you have pruchased. They become much more competent at their duties, and each one gains 1 additional sphere of competence of your choice: strategy, combat, servant duties, artisan, magical researcher. If a sphere is not chosen, they instead gain a monthly use of planeswalking (if you have purchased it). These minions also become 25% cheaper to create. This does not affect you or Gifts of that minion type.

4 
A minion of your choice becomes much more powerful than before. This also affects you if you transform into it, and all Gifts with that minion type.

5 
You gain a powerful melee weapon capable of using Dark Smite with all its modifiers. This weapon can be summoned to your hand once a minute, and if destroyed regenerates in your Sanctum over the course of a week. You can further enchant and imbue this weapon with either Entropic or Elemental magic. If you already have Dark Smite, using it with this weapon is even stronger. This weapon and any aditional ones can be bound to Gifts instead.

6 
You become supremely talented and a master of one of: warfare (includes anything related to it, such as combat and strategy), magic, political affairs (includes all duties relevant to ruling and social skills). You are respected amongst Sons.

7 
Gain 1 Perk. Choose 1 Perk you possess; you can now share this Perk freely with minions, Gifts and descendants. Cannot gain Gifts or Minions this way.

8 
Get rid of any Drawbacks worth up to 2 Maximum Soul Potential. You keep the Maximum Soul Potential. If you've taken no Drawbacks that fulfill this option, you may reroll.

Clicking this gives the 2 Maximum Soul Potential, you have to remove the fitting Drawback yourself.

9 
Gain one Element of your choice. If you have already purchased Elemental Magic, you can instead choose one of the elements you have already purchased (and its Advanced Element, if you have it) to become empowered as if it were a standard Entropic power, no longer requiring mana to function. You master and can make use of this element much more easily, and its overall efficiency and power is greatly increased.

Clicking this gives the 5 Maximum Soul Potential, you have to add your chosen element yourself.

10 
You can choose to roll your Walk Blessed before making your build. If you already have a complete build, you can alter it in any way you please even after rolling your Walk Blessed. You can also begin with your Walk Blessed if you pay green SP for it. You gain 5SP starting off. Planeswalking is also 50% cheaper. Gain a free minion transformation of your choice early, even if you haven't purchased the minion yet. You can choose to reroll up to 4 of your choices again, excluding this one. These rerolled choices can be taken back, allowing you to keep your original rolls. Reroll if you end up with this option more than once.

11 
You gain either Physical Empowerment or Arcane Magic for free, but using and improving them becomes much more difficult and reliant on practice to keep those skills from diminishing in power. They're also very inefficient to make use of. If you already have both, they instead become easier to use and moderately more powerful.

Clicking this gives the 5 Maximum Soul Potential, you have to add your chosen ability yourself.

12 
You gain a large base of operations. It could be a castle, ship, tower, whatever you wish it to be. You can improve and increase its size using large amounts of souls over time, as well as adding functions and comforts to it such as mobility, turrets, traps, utilities, planeswalking, etc. All powered by souls. Inside this base you gain Sleepless, one Extra Life and a small boost to all your abilities. If destroyed, you can resummon it again after a year, but it loses all the improvements you've added to it. Any minions with Easy Transfer can add souls to this base instantly when in direct contact with it. You can teleport to your base once a month regardless of whether you're in the same dimension or not.

13 
You gain access to Holy Magic, and an improved version of Feast of Evil, with upwards of a 4x multiplier to souls taken this way. If you have already purchased Feast of Evil then this multiplier increases to 6x. Your version of Holy Magic does not require mana to use, being powered fully by souls, as such it is as easy to use and improve as your other Entropic Powers.

The extra Perk Point is exclusively for Feast of Evil, if you already had that, leave the Point unspend.

14 
Steal power from the Hound. You improve all your powers marginally whenever you defeat an accordingly powerful opponent. This boost is permanent with some conditions attached to it. You can sense and track a random, nearby Quarry that fulfills these criteria. This Quarry must be hunted down before you can choose a new one. You can track it from anywhere in existence. You can choose to give up your Quarry, at the expense of losing some of the power you've gained so far from other hunts. All your Quarries will also be able to sense you and have a small insight as to the nature of your abilities. If a Gift or minion defeats a Quarry, it counts as your victory. As you grow stronger, your newer Quarries will be chosen from increasingly more powerful beings. If a Quarry defeats you, it stops being a Quarry and you lose a large amount of earned power. Reroll if you end up with this option more than once.

15
 You become capable of conversation with True AIs, and can sense them from nearby dimensions. You can now create complex machinery and digital systems empowered by souls with ease. Mana and other types of energy can be used to add more functionalities to them. Your Dolls, if you have them, can be improved in this way to great degrees. Machines crafted or improved this way are very weak to True AI sabotage. Your Death Mages, Liches and Dracoliches receive this ability too, though to a lesser degree. Reroll if you end up with this option more than once.

16 
You become much more powerful in the Dreamlands, and the beings there will respect you as a being of great influence there. You can now physically enter and exit the Dreamlands with ease. Reroll if you end up with this option more than once.

17 
A nostalgic orange sunset finds you in the morning. Bloom becomes a Flower. You're no longer a Son. You lose half your total SP, you choose which powers to lose this way. You lose all your vows and drawbacks along with their SP. You lose all your other Gifts. You can no longer summon minions, but can transform yourself and others into one. You no can no longer resurrect in any way, even with access to Extra Lives or Phylacteries. All your other Walk Blessed rolls and choices become nullified. Cannot be taken if Multiplayer has been picked. You become an enemy to all Sons. You can choose to reroll this option for free if you fall into it. Requires Bloom.

defaultRowText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.
defaultChoiceText: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.
